Reviews.Title: “nice beach, not much else”
Reviews.Author: jut305
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, wouldn't call it a resort. Rooms are old with newer furnishings. Not much to do in the hotel and its very far away from Rincon. The pool seems nice, the biggest appeal is the private beach which is quite nice. If your looking for seclusion without the feel of a big resort, minimal activities, and dont need any thing above two star lodging than this will suite you fine. But, just be prepared to pay for all meals, including breakfast....Overall not a very good value, much nicer more charming places to stay in Rincon and save about 100 dollars

Reviews.Title: “Rincon Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: cl5610
Reviews.Content: Rincon Beach Resort is always a pleasant place to stay. We have been three times and don't hesitate to go again. The resort is refreshing because it is so open to the sun and breezes. I would never stay in a high rise hotel on the beach in San Juan with only conditioned air. The rooms are not fancy, but very comfortable. The pool and beach are great. It is a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Boutique Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYC_D12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice. The staff was very accommodating and very pleasant throughout our whole stay. The hotel was nicely appointed, the main lobby was small but cozy with a bar located across from the front desk. The pool was very nice, only steps from the beach. The pool had both a jacuzzi and swim up bar which made it quite easy to get drinks when needed. The two restaurants were nice, one is a pool bar/restaurant serving lunch, the food was good and the other was an actual restaurant serving breakfast and dinner. We ate breakfast there a few days and the meal was always good. We never had dinner there but I did read the menu and it looked great and quite unique. The beach was nice but by far not the nicest in the vicinity with some lovely beaches in Isabela and Aguadilla. I would definitely stay there again, as this is the beach where I was engaged to my fiancee.

Reviews.Title: “Please take up the trash on the beach in front of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SharonHerrera
Reviews.Content: Please do have your staff pick up the garbage on the beach that drifts in, there was a lot of it. If they could do that it would be great and environmentally sensitive. It would be nice to walk a clean beach and having a staff person clean it daily would be great. The hotel grounds were very pretty though.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel with Bad Service and Horrible Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Miguel C
Reviews.Content: A year ago, I passed by this hotel to see the place and I found it beautiful, a place to stay. So we decided to place a reservation for last week to relax and have a wonderful family time. Well, the experience was not so relaxing at all. The day we arrived, the bathroom had no water, the toilet didnâ€™t has a toilet cover and not to mention that the bathroom had no space to place your stuff. At 1:00am, the room temperature was like 85Âº, we couldn't sleep. We tried the hotel restaurant the first night and the food and the service was good but what a difference the second night we visited the restaurant, the service was awful, the food was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissH0ney
Reviews.Content: I've been to several waterfront properties/ hotels, but this little gem is by far the best one! The pool area is just perfect, relaxing with a swim up bar & 2 steps to the beach!! The drinks are great (u can ask for what ever u want). The appetizers are very good too! The beach is nice & calm, great area! They have plenty of seating, & shade for those who are not into tanning.. The rooms are very nice, big flat screen (great for connecting laptop to it). Comfy bed. The only Small drawback is that the bathroom is small, but in great shape! To me this is an awesome little gem!!! Love it, so much so that my hubby wants to buy in the apt complex right next door :) The grounds are simply beautiful, lots of lounging areas!! One thing I would suggest is to update & enlarge the gym. The machines don't work & are very rusty..

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: milk99
Reviews.Content: Although we were hesitant because reviews were so so, there is a lot of real pluses. Our first impression was less than great when we were greeted by dead kitten floating in pool the night we arrived, but later found out a litter of kittens had made the hotel their home. The room we had with ocean view was very nice not expansive but very comfortable for the price. Bathrooms were veryclean, but not luxurious. My biggest complaint (I'm an interior designer) is there should have been carpets in the rooms, like sisal or nylon sisal, because there is tile everywhere, and it would be nice for the wet and sand. Lots of outdoor seating with big chairs, day beds, sofas, tables, some even covered for the occasional rain storm. We went to the local Econo grocery store for cereal and sandwich fixings because we find the hotel food and frozen drinks, fair. But the pool, hot tub and beach are really wonderful. We'd sneak upstairs to the 4th Fl terrace where it overlooks the ocean and eat our private meal. Stay here, just plan to eat at some of the local great restaurants that are nearby. We didn't mind the 10 minute drive to Rincon to eat. We liked the privacy and the other guests were so interesting, the kind that like being off the beaten track, not your typical loud fat americans. The comments about the service are correct, for example one of the kittens slept in our room and pee'd and room service came immediately, only it was some guy who kind of knew how to make beds, but he did a great job, so who cares. Very real place, not a packaged product.

Reviews.Title: “A nice family place on the West Coast”
Reviews.Author: crcfhrules
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and stayed here March 17-22 with teenagers aged 16,14,12. Check in and out was a breeze. The front desk was very helpful with questions, directions, restaurants and getting a van out to pick up our crew after an auto accident. No injuries - thank goodness - but be very careful driving in PR. Terrible drivers and most cars it seemed were missing lights at night - front, back, all - just be careful. Room keys seemed to be a problem - ended up going to the front desk several times to have them re-keyed. A pain but not terrible since the resort is not large. The place itself is very clean and the rooms were comfortable. There is not much to do at night or during the day for that matter for the kids - so they found it a bit dull. We did take some surfing lessons at Maria's Beach, which was fun - kids loved. Pool was fine and nice large hot tub. The beach went on for miles - so if walking the beach looking for sea glass is your "thing" then this is the place for you. Pools and ocean water was warm and great for swimming. Ocean was calm - easy swimming for kids. Sunsets were wonderful each night! Ate breakfast at the hotel- It was OK - nothing spectacular - you won't go hungry and it is resonably priced. Ate luch at the pool bar/restaurant - wraps were good and all else was OK, Again, you wont' starve. We ate offsite at Calypso's, The Rum Shack and Villa Confressi - ordered pizza and ate in the lobby another evening. Fun atmosphere at Calypso's and the Rum Shack. Food was fine. Villa Confressi - MahiMahi was the dish to order. Lobster was huge - too much actually - if that's possible. If on the west side, I would stay here again and recommend it to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet and relaxing place, love it!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaDelMar D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at the resort. Not a laaarge hotel, but just perfect to be relax and disconnected from everything for some days. Our ocean view room (2nd floor) with balcony was very clean and comfortable. Very nice personnel. The sunset view was spectacular in that area of my island. A beautiful and well-maintained pool, and a calm beach...just perfect!!.Need to have a car and you will find also another restaurants(especially seafood rest.) and supermarket. Absolutely recommend this resort. We're ready to stay again !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Hotshot1985
Reviews.Content: This is a very good resort, rooms are nice and it's not overcrowded like most resorts, the Brasas restaurant is nice but kinda pricy, for breakfast I wouldn't recommend the buffet, it's not worth the money. Had a few problems but nothing major, had several problems with the room key not working and they tried to overcharge us on our tab but we luckily caught it, the bathroom smelled like mildew but was clean, but overall it's not going to get much better in Puerto Rico, so it's a good choice for the money

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: SusanKF
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed at. Very clean, and the staff was nice and helpful. This place is just gorgeous. Beautiful beach and calm. The breakfast is delicious. Recommend the belgium waffle with their home made guava butter. YUM! The flan is also very good. Would stay there again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “An Experience to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Maryann S
Reviews.Content: Our trip to this beautiful hotel will be a memory that will be enjoyed forever. Everything, yes everything, provided a casual and pleasurable experience. The location offered one of the most natural sites that included a view of the ocean, mountains and the local plant life. (We saw an iguana and hummingbird on the same day!) The amenities completed all our needs. The service by all was spectacular. Clean. Convenient to local restaurants. Can't wait to return to paradise!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: basscomp
Reviews.Content: A very laid back hotel with a lovely beach, a nice big pool, a swim up bar, lovely setting, nice ocean swimming with sandy bottom, comfortable beach chairs, good size fresh beach towels. Moreover, a fairly quiet place, even with families and kids, no loud music blaring, attentive staff. This is not a super luxurious resort...no room service, an OK restaurant, and nothing flashy, but it is a perfect place if you want a retreat where no one bothers you, where you can relax all day with a book and where you can find a nice shady tree to relax under and/or sit in the sun with the ocean and pool just a few steps away. You'll need a car, as it is about a fifteen minute drive from Rincon. Rooms are ample and have small refrigerators and there are supermarkets a short drive away. No snorkelling at beach, but there are tours that can be found in Rincon. We would definitely return for a long weekend or if we had some time to get away as we felt it was a great place just to do nothing for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Nsfromseattle
Reviews.Content: my visit to this place got off to a bad start as they overcharged me above what I had booked on bookings.com. And they charge you up front...i questioned this of staff, but the concierge were well, indifferent.... a young guy, he really didnt want to deal with it, and explained it as tax?! nearly $300. Well, the next morning I went back and did get it corrected by a concierge who understood and actually cared- super service. Apparently, their sales reservationist had improperly put in a higher daily rate on my reservation. Ok so that got corrected, but then I went to go to their breakfast buffet, and ran into the waiter from Disservice...didnt get seated, then was seated in hallway where they stacked the children seats...then watched the "service" as I was ignored and they kissed up to the PR's locals around me...really sorta insulting ..anyhow, I walked out, then the guy gave me attention..."you pay,..and the classic faux paux of service he says "you are are the problem"....so we- and now this is getting absurdly wierd and funny- go back to the nice cocierge and we go our separate ways and I dont pay the for breakfast....and they offer me dinner etc. Really, im a low key guy, who avoids confrontation, but this was just wierd... Have you ever seen the waiter on BCCs Fault towers? maybe perhaps because I was travelling alone they kinda ignored me...never had this experience before. After that all was good, the suite- and it was sweet- was very nice, and beach location awsome...I would say I do believe they treat PRs better than other visitors...and weekends are overrun with PR families...and they are loud, sorry hate to stereotype...finally mine might be a random bad experience that goes with travelling, but It was what it was....

Reviews.Title: “short but worthwhile stay”
Reviews.Author: lucylou521
Reviews.Content: My husband , daughter and i just needed to get away for a few days and someone recommended we stay here, what a great 3 days! It could not have been more relaxing. We found the people to be so friendly and accommodating, our room was perfect and the breakfast was delicious. The resort itself was tranquil and there were a lot of families with small children who were delightful. The beach is intimate with spectacular sunsets and offers great swimming. The swim up bar in the pool is just an added bonus. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: evriv
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and accommodating. Our room was not ready but they quickly found us another room. The main area, bar and pool are all very nice and typical resort decor. The rooms however are in serious need of updating and cleaning. This resort is not worth the rates! Overall the service was good the bar/beach staff were very nice and friendly as was the front desk. The evening bartender makes the best mojitos! Day 2 we had NO HOT WATER and in the late afternoon I was locked out of my room and had to walk back to front desk to fix my card key. So did my husband a few hours later!????? No reason still don't understand why! The rooms needs serious updating. The doors in the room look beat up and the bathrooms are 1980's style. Again not worth the rates. Overall the beach and pool area was nice. I felt safe here and the parking lot is private. Don't think I will be back but enjoyed my 3 night stay as we town hopped. By the way I highly recommend Banana D'ang for great coffee and smoothies in Rincon a little out of the way but worth it for the great coffee and unusual fast service in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location; Great Potential... Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon N
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife invited me to RBR for my birthday. We selected RBR because we stayed there before and love the tranquility and location of this place. Too bad service has fall too low and the facilities need some update. I can say that I have stayed in hotels from 0 to 5 stars. We checked in just fine. As soon as we arrive in the room, things started to fall apart. First a handle in the bathroom and then the A/C sounded more like an old airplane turbine than a smooth A/C. At night then it happened. The A/C shut down for more then 20 minutes. Our happy neighbors from the floor above were probably celebrating their honeymoon. We heard everything. In this hotel, if the A/C shuts down you can hear everything side ways and up way! I was must entertained first, then after the third and four intimate detail it was enough! Not even in a Motel have I ever hear such details. The A/C was still shut!!! We call front desk and the offered to change room then, at probably 2:00 a.m. An offer we were not going to accept, who would at that time! At morning, the other day, they were As Rude as it Gets! After a while they decided to change us to another room. Manager on duty- Supervisor was a zero to the left on attention to our complaints. We knew that Brasas was out the question. Way to expensive and we have dinned there before. This is a fine property. However, poor management and services would sadly forecast the demise of another important part of the economy in western Puerto Rico. On the plus side, don't miss Das Alpen Restaurant in Downtown Rincon, if you are nearby. Food was superb. P.D. Congratulations to Honeymooners that stayed for presidential weekend on room 416?!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fanofsissy
Reviews.Content: We had the best time here. Wonderful location, great atmosphere, super friendly staff, delicious food. What a jewel!

Reviews.Title: “Swim up bar was a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: ChanelCinq
Reviews.Content: I had a friend flying in from San Francisco and we wanted a mini get away. Last year I went to Rincon for president's day weekend and I decided to do the same this year. This property has a swim up bar so we figured there would probably be less children then at other resorts. Well we were wrong. There were a lot of children. We wanted a get away and it could have been a bit more relaxing without children but in all honesty there were a few drunk people living at the swim up bar that were far more of a nuisance then the well behaved children. We booked a deluxe ocean view room and ended up with a view of the play ground so we heard the kids playing in the morning. I never remembered reading on their site that there was a play ground. We arrived at around noon and our room was not ready until about 5PM. It was a holiday weekend so I am sure they were scrambling but we had booked our room 6 weeks prior. The room was "OK." There was a tiny fridge on the floor. The lights by the bed did NOT turn off unless you moved the furniture and unplugged them, and the beds were very, very hard to the point my back was hurting both mornings. The swim up bar was a lot of fun but my friend that was with me in San Francisco and who owns a bar of his own expected the bar tender to help people in order. I told my friend that this is Puerto Rico and you have to shout to get service. So he adapted to the Puerto Rican ways. The bar tender was really good at concocting the perfect drink for each person. Some of those were super crazy strong. We decided not to go in the pool the second day because there were about a dozen people drinking from 11 AM to sunset and they never left the pool. I can only imagine how many chemicals would be needed to be dumped in there to clean out all of their urine. So we opted for the ocean instead which was more fun. The place was fine, not worth the 275 for Sat night but Sunday night was 125 which was a fine price for the place. I would skip their breakfast buffet and find something else. If you do eat there pay a few dollars extra and get an item off the menu that is made to order.

Reviews.Title: “OK Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: Newish and reasonably attractive property a couple of miles out of downtown Rincon. Hotel and condos. Our dbl bedded room was fairly large but spartan. Small bathroom. Bed linens fair. No screens on windows. Breezeway entry to the lobby very pretty but it kind of ends there. Lush landscaping, but not well taken care of. "Not well taken care of" seems to be how they operate. There is a good chance your pool chaise might be dirty. Pool Area lunch was okay with light fare. Restaurant looked nice. Workout area had about 5 pieces of gear with, of course, no towels. There are a cluster of restaurants about 3/4 of a mile up the hill from the resort. I would definitely have a car. I'm ambivalent about this place because I didn't hate it, nor did I really like it. It is nicer than the Rincon By The Sea if your considering that option. Would I make a special effort to stay here? No. If I had occasion to be in Rincon again, this is probably your best choice as far as larger properties go.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Katherine M
Reviews.Content: It should be noted that this Resort isn't actually in Rincon. It is situated on the bay so the beach is very calm and safe. It is great for kids as you don't have to worry about the reef. the other beaches in rincon are harder to access and you should wear some kind of water shoe to protect your feet from things. We are in our thirties and found the crowd here to be eirther much older or groups of people with their small children. We stayed away from the resort because there were many kids and families with loud music and screaming kids. The buildings are all concrete so you can hear everything. We were orignially in a room with an adjoining door and could hear the other person's TV clearly (room 415). Our second room was clean and had a view of the pool and water (room 303). The rooms were clean and safe. The hotel staff were friendly. As to be expected the drinks were over priced. We actually had a cooler on the beach and nobody said anything. The restaurant was okay. You should also have a car rental. You will need to drive to get anywhere. The sunsets here were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beach & pool area nice, rooms ok.”
Reviews.Author: Habaman
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to relax, then I would recommend this hotel since the pool and the private beach are very nice. However the hotel is situated 10 minutes by car from Rincon so it is a bit far from the "city" compared to some other hotel options. The rooms are not the newest or finest but they do their job. Be sure to get the room that you pay for. We reserved an ocean view room and the result was that we got a room with a tree view and a slight chance to see the ocean from the balcony. But after complaining about this they switched the room to a better one (the switch was so easy that it feeled like they knew that they had given us a poor view room). The reason why I give 4 stars is the beach and the pool area since the hotel didn't itself impress me very much. Without the beach/pool I would've given 3 stars. Also: we got a deal from hotels.com, the gym is small, pool food was good and the restaurants breakfast is ok (about 15 dollars).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: alfgomezjr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in this hotel. It was our first time in this hotel and our experience was extremely pleasant. Although it is not a 5 star hotel, they made us feel at home. For $199 a night, including taxes and breakfast for 2 every morning, there is not much more you can ask for. Breakfast is a la carte (weekends are a la carte and buffet) with very creative and delicious alternatives. A note about breakfast charges: breakfast was included in our package but you have to sign for the charges to your room. Then, at check-out, those charges are deducted from your bill. The pool bar is very good and the bartender, Jose, is extremely good and friendly. The pool restaurant is also very good and offers a variety of dishes, from burgers to ribs and everything in between. The room we selected had two beds, very comfortable, a view of the pool from the balcony and was spacious. Housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Every employee we met was very nice and courteous. Even the janitors said hello every time they met you. Brasas restaurant served very good food. It is not cheap but the quality of the food made it worthwhile. Check-in and check-out was fast and effortless. The beach is good with minimal surf, although at this time of the year, the water is cold by tropical standards. You can walk on the beach for a long time but use sunblock or you will regret it. If you like picking what I call "drift glass" (pieces of broken glass polished by the sand and gravel and wave action) there are lots of them. We were very impressed with this hotel and plan to return in the near future. The hotel was not crowded due to the fact that we arrived on Thursday and classes were in session. I expect that during summer it will be crowded. There is no casino or disco in this hotel but who cares. We go to hotels to relax and have quality time together. Also, I must mention that there are no attraction for kids o teenagers except the pool but since we were alone, it did not matter. The only thing that I would change is: free WiFi in the public areas. NOTE: This hotel is not in the town of RincÃ³n. It is in the town of AÃ±asco, about 10'15 minutes from RincÃ³n.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sunsets, perfect beach, peaceful, good food, good service...”
Reviews.Author: Sharonarl
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was peaceful and has a beautiful beach right in front of the pool. Ate at Brasas, the hotel restaurant, and both the salmon and the stuffed chicken breast were delicious. The room had a King bed with ocean view, wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to hide from work and relax”
Reviews.Author: Localad
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is located in a very quiet spot by the sea. If possible, ask for the first floor rooms nearby the pool/beach. They have a balcony that have direct access to both places. The pool is clean, you can find beach chairs along the beach area and the pool. If you like to read under the palms or take a nap, there are few spots. You can take a good walk along the coast and simply spend the afternoon. Rooms were clean, with great service everyday. The hotel is beautiful with many places to lay back. Wireless Internet is available for an additional $10.00 a day. The small gym is at the 4th floor, clean and good if you need to. Employees were polite and always on time. The Restaurant Brasas is a good option if you're looking for dinning (around $20's p/p), the breakfast buffet isn't cheap but you're going to enjoy it. There are a few places to eat around for less either way to Rincon or Mayaguez (12-15 mnts), but you will need a car. It's a great place to disconnect from work and routine and relax. You'll have not only great pics, but also memories. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: jcmbdm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here after having spent new years eve at a lively hotel in Ponce. The peaceful setting was a wonderful contrast. The hotel felt like an upscale private residence.The pool had a large hot tub that was not too hot so you could luxuriate in it for a long time and enjoy the ocean view. We had dinner at the hotel on the little outdoor patio. The food was good but a little over priced compared. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Resort and Privacy we desired”
Reviews.Author: JandAsDad
Reviews.Content: Our family of four enjoyed the beautiful location on a quiet beach. We love the calm water and clean sand. As other reviewers commented, the staff was at an arm's length throughout our stay - and we considered that OK. The staff did promptly respond to all our needs. Those considering staying here need to keep in mind that the main patronage of the resort are residents of PR, thus american standards are not always their goal. Our room was nothing outstanding, but clean, quiet, and comfortable. When the resort became busy, there was still enough staff to keep public areas clean as well as timely maid service for our room. One thing we were surprised about was how many non-lodging people came to the resort for the day. We felt somewhat tight at the pool area and found this was because people were coming there for the day to enjoy the beach and pool areas. We found wait staff to be friendly and provided us good service - and our food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Private and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Beverly G
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay at resorts, so I don't have anything similar to compare this to. It made a good first impression the way the lobby was open with the sounds and breezes of the outdoors all right there. The rooms were typical of any nice generic hotel. It was difficult to get onto the internet in the room. We used the internet to look up places to visit, restaurants, etc. so this was frustrating at times. The water was calm and relaxing. The beach was clean and not crowded. People were friendly. The restaurant is expensive, so we bought a few things at the store to put in the tiny refrigerator so we could have breakfast on the patio area. They do have complimentary coffee. You have to get it from just inside the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The best location with just average service”
Reviews.Author: ulysses2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently spent a few days at this hotel. The location on the coast is perfect, on a perfect quiet beach. The hotel was actually not crowded at all, which is why I don't understand why the staff was not more engaging or even just friendly. They generally did not seem to care. The bartender who had us wait five minutes before acknowledging us (the bar is really small so being ignored was kind of awkward). Dinner while tasty was also strange, you are in this beautiful setting yet the restaurant is set back with no ocean view and closed windows and blasting air conditioning (also the plates were not really clean,... Grease marks on the edges). The only person with a constant smile who was "trying to make our vacation special" was the pool restaurant waitress, she was very serviable and kind. In the end we really liked this place but were disappointed by the service (from my experience that has to do with how management drives and enables a friendly and engaging team atmosphere)... Hope they improve...

Reviews.Title: “Servicio pesimo”
Reviews.Author: Ivol_93
Reviews.Content: Llegamos a 'hotel' el 23 de noviembre y apenas llegamos el trato fue hostil y poco profesional. El 24 de noviembre tuvimos serios problemas en el desayuno, luego que estaba incluido nos los querÃ­an cobrar, al final fue un error y estaba incluido pero la actitud fue muy pÃ©sima. Ese mismo dÃ­a en la playa tuvimos un percance con el gerente de la planta fÃ­sica y con la seÃ±ora en recepciÃ³n. Decidimos irnos. La estadÃ­a era por 4 dÃ­as pero al dÃ­a 2 nos fuimos.

Reviews.Title: “Great few days away”
Reviews.Author: farm2fork
Reviews.Content: Great lobby for hanging out with your loved one and sipping on champagne while enjoying the ocean breeze. We stayed two nights and although the room could use some updating the hotel was nice an we'd go again. We relaxed in the pool with drinks and took naps under a palm tree on the beach. Our stay was short but we enjoyed the hotel and felt relaxed upon our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in a secluded area of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Ilovestcroix
Reviews.Content: Lobby is stunning, with an outdoor arch overlooking the pool, beach and an incredible sunset. Two pools, a large jacuzzi, and a great beach await you. The staff cannot have been friendlier. The restaurant had wonderful food and my chilean sea bass melted in my mouth. The rooms were large and ours had a balcony overlooking the ocean. The price was moderate and well worth it. I am looking forward to a return trip. Although the address says Anasco, it is really just about 1 mile from Rincon. What a find!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation with a wedding”
Reviews.Author: Floridee
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay from the Rehearsal Patio Party, Birthday Party and the grandest wedding ever! However we had time to visit, swim, relax by the beach and make a 3 day stay seem like a vaction.

Reviews.Title: “Marriage package is wonderful here!”
Reviews.Author: yup_1976
Reviews.Content: Yup....we got married there in May of 2007. I am a little slow to do a review, but they deserve it. Thank you Stephanie (if you are still there) for making our stay and ceremony so special.....I hope you like the shot glasses:). Anyway, the rooms are great. It is a nice quaint little boutique resort which is very romantic. Plenty of places to go eat and close to in town activities. The staff is very accommodating (they even brought a personal cd player radio and let me borrow it to play our wedding song in our room). My brother-in-law had 12 dozen roses sent and requested they remove all the pedals and spread around the room before we got there.....boy was it beautiful. They did a fantastic job. Overall great stay and staff was out of this world....I highly recommend....especially for the wedding package!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool,trashy beach, overall poor service and definitely would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Peggymd
Reviews.Content: We reserved a king ocean view room months prior to our stay. When we checked in we got 2 queen size beds in a room stuffed in the corner with a garden view of the parking lot. When we asked about it they had no other rooms available. In addition the bathroom window of this room had been left open. The shower was crawling with ants that continued to the bathroom floor. We did get a king bed room the next day after our continued follow up to get what we reserved. The king room did not have an ocean view but we accepted it as they continued to explain all rooms were booked. Service was terrible. They only had one person at the front desk and even though only one person was at the counter it seemed to take forever. We did get internet service in the first room on the first night. When we moved we had no Internet and was told it would cost an additional $10 per day. Really we thought? We were inconvenienced had to move and paying nearly $200 per night.The pool was clean and nice. The beach however was a mess. The beach was full of debris and trash and you had to be very careful in your attempt to get to the ocean. If this "resort" was "booked" we never saw it. We rarely ran into people as we came and went. There was only one place Brasas to eat and again the service in addition to the food was terrible! Our drinks were never refreshed at dinner and we waited so long for bill we got up to get it ourselves. Again there were only about 4 other tables occupied so the lack of service was not because they were busy by any means. The next day we attempted to give this one and only restaurant a try for their buffet breakfast. At $14 per person there was not much available. The eggs meat and potatoes were all cold! Obviously we did not eat their again! The only thing we enjoyed was the clean and near empty pool. Everything else was Definitely not worth the price or effort to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place with awful service”
Reviews.Author: velma d
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our wedding on the beach.the spot was great!But do not expect any special care from the hotel staff. They did not arranged the activity the way we contracted.Be aware and count the alcohol bottles!!!!they love to charge but not to serve!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: emontalvogc
Reviews.Content: Awsome,sure there are cosmetic needs but your not here to look at the walls!! This hotel mekes you and your significant other feel like your on a secluded island.Dont forget to get up early at low tide and take a stroll on the beach around the bend and enjoy Secluded miles of beach. Great place to spend time with wife or gf!!The view and sounds of the surf from the open lobby and bar out to the infinity pool and beach just create love in the air. Also easy to watch children from pool or beach.Look for specials that include breakfast and parking and gratuities.I wish we could have stayed longer..thanx Eric and Monica

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moomduck1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for a conference that my husband was attending. I thought that the staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool was nice and so was the beach. I had lunch twice by the pool and really enjoyed it. We ate at the restaurant at the hotel one night. It was also very nice. Just to warn people though - monfongo stuffed with seafood - I mistakenly did not ask what kind of seafood, and found 3 whole baby octopi inside! Lesson learned. We would definitely stay there again. The "fitness center" was really just a regular room stripped of furniture, and had 1 treadmill, 1 biking machine, some weights and a broken eliptical.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our villa again!”
Reviews.Author: LaylahG
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time we stay at this boutique hotel in the last 5 or so years. First time there we use our AMEX card and received an upgrade to one of the villas. The villas are so AMAZING (we have never tried a standard room). You get one room with balcony, full kitchen, dining room, living room with a full sofa bed and a second TV which came really handy for our 12 yr old son. Only one bathroom, but the 5 of us managed. They gave us a comfy real â€œportableâ€� twin bed for our son. Hotel was packed, but service was fast. Employees, all really nice to everyone. This July they gave us a $100 credit to use in the hotel. Four of us took the buffet; my husband ordered his favorite egg Benedict from the menu. Breakfast was really good. This time they didnâ€™t have a babysitter service. Will return again soon. Thanks to Wilfredo in room service and Luis in Reservations that made this last minute 4th of July vacation possible for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location ...but dissapointing room.”
Reviews.Author: Aruac0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rincon Beach one weekend in July. Its location is perfect! The common areas (lobby,pool, gardens,etc.) are well taken care of. Beautiful gardens! We didn't try the restaurant but heard it was good. The beach although small is also nice. The staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. Our only complaint is the room. Clean but in need of basic repairs. I stayed at this hotel when it first opened and this room is showing the signs of time. The price tag does not correspond with what the room offers. Hopefully somebody will pay attention to this review and act on it. It's a nice hotel with a lot of potential. I will love to see it going back to what it was!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EvetteR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, always kept up to par. Rooms were spacious, service was good, pool was always clean, great pool bar. Would stay again. Also the hotel has free parking which is great as many other hotels charge in the range of $15 to $20 parking fee per day. Didn't eat at the Restaurant onsite, prices were a bit expensive, but if you want to eat local foods there were many local restaurants by the beach where one could eat, practically the same thing for much less money. The room has a fridge I would advise buying your water or any other beverages at the local Walgreen's which wasn't too far and packing the fridge especially if traveling with kids. Overall I give it an A-.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite live up to what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: sailgirl33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort for 3 nights. I was actually slightly disappointed in the hotel. The original room they booked for us faced the road. On the other side of the road was a very loud bar that played music well into the night. We requested to have a "quiet" room so they moved us to one that had a better location but was a connecting room. Fortunately our neighbors were fairly quiet, but you could hear everything, which kind of ruined the whole "get away from it all" vibe. The hotel staff, particularly the women, seemed annoyed at being asked for anything. There were two male staffers that were fantastic, the others, however, seemed mildly disinterested in everything, including the customers. The pool was quite nice, the beach area was nice but not particularly interesting, as there were no fish that could be viewed snorkeling and no waves for body boarding. The food was excellent though the restaurant itself was rather slow to seat people sometimes. The restaurant staff were quite nice. The hallways were all outdoors and there were a fair number of dead bugs everywhere. I know it is the caribbean, but it wouldn't have killed them to mop it down every once in awhile. For the money, I was really expecting more and would probably advise people to look for vacation rentals in downtown Rincon - much cheaper, much closer to the surfing, snorkeling beaches, good restaurants, etc. The downtown vibe of Rincon is lively, this hotel is a good 10 from downtown Rincon. My boyfriend took a surfing lesson with Puntas surf school and had a blast. Just watch out for sea urchins - I stepped on one and it was not pleasant)! I would recommend the hotel, but would recommend first staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but bar staff needs help”
Reviews.Author: lilai8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is paradise!!! The rooms are great, but try to ask for one close to the pool. The pool is Eecellent and the pool bar a definite plus. The front desk staff was SUPER nice and accomodating. However, the kitchen at Brasas Restaurant took a little long to make our food. The wait was well worth it. The chicken stuffed with "viandas" was awesome!!! The "mofongo" stuffed with seafood delicious!! The only setback was that the staff at both bars was in the weeds most of the time because there were many people and they didn't have backup. The bartender in the lobby needed a barback to keep him "stocked" and the Ice full. The same thing happened at the pool kiosk. Linda, the server was super nice there, but clearly she needed help. The two bartenders in the pool bar and in the lobby bar were rude at times. It seemed that it was a unique situation because we were there for a wedding and many guests got there early, so in the future, a little planning will help this situation.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay but be aware...”
Reviews.Author: stickeq
Reviews.Content: The place is great for a quiet place to return to when you have been sight seeing. If you are used to having carpet in the rooms don't stay here since the rooms are all tiled. The only thing the upset me the most was that the roll away beds are $45 per night instead of the usual $10-15/night. Everything else was great. There is a whole in the wall, I restaurant with excellent PR food called Mahi Mahi, by route 2.

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive hotel that gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: kikicole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort for two nights. This hotel is pretty bare bones, but if you're looking for a cheap place to stay in a very pretty area of Puerto Rico, then this may be your place. The rooms were very livable - the beds are comfortable, the bathroom was only missing bottles of shampoo and conditioner (there's a receptcle on the wall with shampoo and soap), but overall, the room offered what it needed to offer. We had dinners two evenings on site - they were for the event I was attending, but I found the food to be delicious, and the mango margaritas to be very good too. On Friday when we got a lot of rain, the hotel let the bartender go who manned the pool bar - so later in teh day when the sun came out, you had to go into the lobby to get drinks and food - but the folks working - while overworked - also worked to be very helpful and provide what we needed. There was sadly no spa and the gym is quite small. It's a nice hotel - nothing fancy or over the top - but a cheap place to stay for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “a first rate, underutilized hotel that gives great value”
Reviews.Author: Pentwater--summerjoy
Reviews.Content: Bought 4 nights here on Skyauction for approximately $90/night (taxes included). A GREAT value. Hotel is immaculate, quiet, and offers both comfortable rooms and great service. Pool is long, beautiful, very warm and right on the beach, which is itself immaculate. Yes, it's 3 hours from San Juan, but this side of Puerto Rico has warm, calm ocean water (San Juan typically has rough water) and is less noisy and congested. Why this hotel didn't have more customers during spring break I'll never know, but this is a bargain you should grab before more people discover it.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: milliejz
Reviews.Content: perfect getaway,relaxing place ,very nice beach,i will be back soon,love this place

Reviews.Title: “lucky score!!”
Reviews.Author: goldenjake
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to respond to Amelia who was there just a week before me. We paid $200 for a room right over the pool, facing the beach, listening to the small waves lap the shore. I NEVER felt like it was cheap in any way. It was a huge room, with couch, chairs, balcony that seated 8 people easily. The bathroom was HUMUNGOUS......there was a walkin closet with a safe, a fridge and lots of hangers. Room 209. As a matter of fact, I went fishing at Rincon Marina with a guide, and caught mahi mahi and the hotel chef cooked the fish for us, and did an excellent job. Not sure what you paid for your room Amelia, but just a heads up, sometimes in places like these, a few dollars in room upgrade goes a LONG way. Lets say you paid $100 for your "hotel 6" room, and you stayed 6 days. Assuming you both work, for an extra $300 each, you whole experience would have been different. Went surfing at Isabella beach with large waves, about 25 mins away. YES, you absolutely need a rental car in Rincon. All the other things you said were pretty correct, but next time, spring for a better room. I always ask to see the room before I take the room key, and try to finagle a better room by offering more and more money until its the room I like. You can almost always find a happy medium. Even if you are on a budget, when you consider the expense of getting there, the time away from work, and all that, a few hundred bucks is ALWAYS well worth it. One more thing. I always pre tip the key people, the people you will deal with everyday: pool bartender, pool waitress, front desk people, lobby bartender.......In other words when I ordered my first Medalla (local beer) the first day, I gave him a $20. From then on, when he saw me coming, he ran over. Most people dont believe in this method, like the people we met at the lobby bar that first night, who were leaving the next day after being there a week. They said it was pretty much all good, except the pool bartender was a jerk, and they had to wait like 15 mins each time they went to order a drink. I said "did you tip him?" They said hell no, why should they, he SUCKED! Exactly. Like the room, it cost me a MERE $20 to ensure the guy gave me great service for 5 days.........of course, in the end I tipped him around $40.........SO WHAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Tommybug
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say if you travel to this side of the island it has some of the most amazing beaches. Rincon Beach Resort is on a beach where you can walk forever. It made for wonderful walks on the beach at all times of the day. I would have to say that our room was nice, although it was nothing special. But we weren't in our room much anyways. The views from the hotel, the beach and pool were enough for us to say that we would go back here in an instant! If you are looking for a ton to do this would not be the resort for you. It was very nice and relaxing and EXACTLY what we needed. The area of Rincon is wonderful, very laid back style, lots of surfing beaches and snorkling areas. We ate at the restaurant at the resort the first night, it was decent. The pool bar had decent food as well, if you like fish I would suggest the Tuna sandwhich....it was great! It is best to have a car if you are staying here, I would suggest it highly since you will be able to see a lot more and you can go and enjoy other local restaurants that are close by. The Lighthouse that is past Rincon is a wonderful place to see great views and you will drive through the town Rincon itself. There is a local grocery in Rincon that we ended up buying some drinks at, this was called Econo. All in all this was a wonderful stay and the people at the hotel were very nice. I would definatly go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Oriented family resort”
Reviews.Author: drcsep
Reviews.Content: Good resort with private beach and nice pool. Wifi available at room, but expensive. Resort should provide free Internet wifi service. Restaurant with excellent choices of dinner plates. Continental breakfast also good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kcaulfield
Reviews.Content: We came to this resort very late after leaving the Lazy Parrot. dirty, no service and telling us to leave our car left open with all our stuff out. We were pleased to with secure, gated parking lot and pleasent rooms. Great food! We walked on the beach late at night and enjoyed the pool and hot tub early in the morning. Nicely kept rooms and grounds and very friendly front desk. Made for a great evening and restful sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Turned off by unfriendly frontdesk staff.”
Reviews.Author: LSerran0
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Rincon Beach Resort. We love the setting on the beach and pool and also like the fact that it is quiet and peaceful but only a short drive to great restaurants and bars in Rincon. With the exception of the two ladies at the front desk during the day, the hotel staff is warm and friendly and helpful. The ladies at thefront desk are in need of customer service training. No welcome. No smile. During our stay if we needed to approach the front desk for service we were ignored while they stared at the computer or conversed with each other. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary”
Reviews.Author: gatorgirl32216
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice but the staff was horrible. First they checked us into a dirty room, then they gave us a room without a view and was flooded. Our reservations were for a ocean view. The staff did not appologize and did not care about us as guest, when we asked for a discount, they said no. The best part of this hotel was the swim up bar!

Reviews.Title: “Lovey spot but not without faults”
Reviews.Author: desertprince
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property with a beautiful pool, well maintained ground, and a terrific beach. But if you're looking for lots to do, social activities, an active bar, or fine dining, this isn't the place. While a very attractive facility, it would be a stretch to call this a three star hotel. Highlights: beautiful beach but badly littered with leaves and debris. Hadn't been raked in months. Very nice pool and grounds. Service, while not particularly welcoming, ranged from helpful to indifferent. Quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Lowlights: Clean, but tired furnishings. Rooms badly in need of refurnishing. Chipped porcelain in bathtub. Limited bathroom amenities. Had to ask for a bar of soap. Very out of the way location. Don't even think about coming here without a car. Nearest town and decent restaurants are a considerable distance away. No shopping to speak of. Brasas restaurant was disappointing. Pelican grill even more so. The entire Rincon area lacks the infrastructure to support any serious degree of tourism. A 2 1/2 hour drive from San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, and fun!”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler002
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific time - swimming in the ocean and the pool, hanging in the jacuzzi, eating in the delicious (if not cheap) restaurant, kayaking, playing (outdoor) ping pong, (human-size) chess, etc. Highly recommended as a comfortable getaway in a beautiful part of the island with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “If staying longer that a weekend, a rental car is a must!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cammi32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and it was a beautiful place, away from everything. If staying longer than a weekend, a rental car is a must. Taxi rides becomevery pricey. I gave the location a 5 based on if you wanted to be away from the hustle and bustle of everything. I thought the staff were great, friendly, and helpful. There are a few restaurants within a 15 minute walk up the hill. The food at the hotel is pricey, but delicious. However, after a few days you get really tired of eating there. I'm not sure what a resort consists of, but this was not a resort as far as I could tell. Maybe having a small gym, restaurant and bar make it a resort????? I would go again, I guess on the saying, the devil you knowis better than the devil you don't know...but will rent a car and STRONGLY reccomend others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - great food”
Reviews.Author: Mycena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this medium-sized resort hotel for Christmas and had a wonderful, relaxing time. The beach was lovely and clean, the pool and spa were nice, the service was great and friendly, and the food was superb and reasonably priced. The menu was creative - the duck was divine with arroz mopostiano, and the tapas were savory and ample, and all of it was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, isolated, inconsiderate management, not well equipped”
Reviews.Author: LeakyB85
Reviews.Content: Lovely setting, with small private beach and jewel of a pool. But that's the best of it. Sheets not long enough for king bed (so your sheet will share the bed pad with previous bed users), glasses smeared off rather than washed, challenged about "hot internet deals" (long wait through phone call where manager obviously asked if guest had a printout of the deal, since the desk clerk looked at it and said "si, tiene" <never assume someone can't speak your language>), and worst: very very loud music on Saturday night for wedding, which they only alerted guests about two hours before it happened. Room is okay, but everything is old. You should call first to find out if they are going to have a special event. Restaurant overpriced, but better things nearby -- though nothing is within walking distance and you wouldn't feel safe walking if it was (busy highway). You won't really be able to see much from your room, because palm and other trees are in the way (like having a low room in Hawaii). Note that I was here for business, followed by two days of leisure, and that I would recommend to a friend only if they wanted an isolated place and didn't mind the funkiness.

Reviews.Title: “Irresponsible management”
Reviews.Author: arlitz
Reviews.Content: After spending 4 wonderful days in San Juan, my companion and I drove to Anasco for a 3 night stay. The drive took us about 5 hours with intense traffic, and the way you have to go through towns as the roads forces you. Tired and curious, we arrived at the Rincon Resort at sunset. There were only about 10 cars in the parking lot. The front desk agent was straight forwardâ€¦â€�Here is your key and this is how you get to your roomâ€� . To our dismay, the room was far from anything called â€œDe Luxeâ€� accommodations, as it says in the website and the brochure. It was a handicapped room on the first floor, although we are not handicapped and never asked for a handicapped room! The â€œZenithâ€� TV was from the 1990â€™s and had operational problems. The towels (just 1 per guest) were the quality of a $1 dollar store. Other items in the room were just the same, completely out of industry standardsâ€¦Bad ambiance light, outdated art work, grease cushions and extremely cold tile flooring, with no rugs. There was a wood box inside the closet, containing the frig. The box was so bitten and chipped that looked like a piece got from a dumpster. The ceiling was finished with â€œpop corn textureâ€� . The bed smelled like damp, and since there were no screen doors to the terrace, the bugs (mosquitoes) invaded the room. The terrace faced a metal fence (the propertyâ€™s limit) and some greenery â€“ A very dull and unattractive view (well, NO view) - I went to the front desk and asked if they could give us another room as we were not happy at all with what they gave us. The front desk agent said she only had ONE other room, and gave me the key so I could go see it. This other room was very similar, but with a ceiling fan hanging from a pole that was bent, making loud noises to perform because it was totally crooked. I went back to the front desk and explained what I saw. The woman reacted as if what I reported was impossible! She said she didnâ€™t have any other rooms available, but maybe the next day. No, how come they didnâ€™t have another room with10 cars in the parking lot!? I gathered the hotel had at least 50 rooms. Back in the handicapped room, I spent about Â½ hour killing mosquitoes before going to sleep, as they were buzzing in our ears and biting us. The next morning at 7 AM, we woke up with MAJOR noise coming from upstairs. An attendant decided to move furniture in the room right above us, by dragging each piece out to the terrace.I walked outside the room and yelled at him upstairs, begging to stop the noise. He was apologetic, but why in heavens a staff person would do some like that?! Donâ€™t they know guests are probably sleeping at 7am when they are on vacation? The resort itself, the beach and the pool looked ok, but nothing special that you dream about the Caribbean. You can not walk to anywhere for food due to the resort location, unless you drive several miles. If you depend to eat on the "resort" your only choice is the very â€œcoldâ€� restaurant that has a large glass window that doesnâ€™t open. Water drips down this glass window because the air conditioning temperature inside is 50 degrees, while it is 90 degrees outside. After eating an overpriced breakfast with our sweaters on, we decided to leave. Checking-out at the front desk, the manager came over and looked straight down to the computer to "approve" the cancellation. She never looked at us, or asked why we were leaving 3 days earlierâ€¦She just stroke a few keys in the computer and went straight back to her office. Our conclusion isâ€¦The Rincon Resort staff is FAR from accomplishing adequate costumer service or any effort to make guests enjoy their stay. If at least the staff was pleasant, guests could say that the â€œpeople were niceâ€�â€¦at minimum. Unfortunately, both staff and room amenities were terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small cozy beach resort”
Reviews.Author: KrisPena
Reviews.Content: Pools are great; fun Chess games, ping pong and playground for kids. Only drawbacks are the location - it was hard to find at night and nothing within walking distance. Not a problem if you have a car. Hotel restaurant was a bit pricey so plan to drive elsewhere to eat. Great surfing nearby (short drive). Rooms were comfortable, quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but far from everything...”
Reviews.Author: svwc
Reviews.Content: As we already knew, Rincon is on the SouthWest tip of the island and it's a nice place to go if you want to get away from it all & just relax by the beach. We went for 1 night to check it out as a possible wedding venue but we decided that for our guests, many of which are flying in from the states & making it a mini vacation, it is not the best location. The pool was refreshing although the swim-up bar was not open because the bartender decided not to show up. The beach was nice & the staff as well. The food at Brasas Restaurant was delicious & not too pricey. It was hard to find the hotel coming from San Juan. Definitely fly into Aguadilla if you plan to stay there. Nothing to do at night! Oh and there was construction going on during the day which was a little annoying when you're looking for a quiet, relaxing escape.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay and good value with some minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Gonebung
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night as we took the late night light from FLL to Aguadilla, we had rented a car at Charlies and had no trouble finding the Hotel (20 minutes fro Airport). The lady at check in was very nice, upgraded our room for free and was all smiles and spoke English well. Pool is really nice and the beach was close and plenty of space and chairs available. The water was like a bathtub though and bit murky (very un-carribean like) We were assuming that there would be more of a surf but it was OK. Drinks at the swimup bar were reasonably priced ($5 for a Rum and coke). It is a layed back and quiet area, cute little towns, which we enjoyed and was a welcome change from the hustle and commercialised San Jaun area. The locals were all very nice. The problem was there was construction going on at the hotel and it began at 7:00am we were not too close to the construction but it still disturbed us. I spoke to the manager and was told that the construction would be completed by October 1st 2010 Since we like the beaches and the surf we went searching for a better beach than the one at the hotel and found some beauties a little further north up the coast. Particularly La Ruina Beach which you have to drive through a golf course to get to. Also Crashboat Beach was really nice. One evening we drove 40 minutes to La Paguera where we took a boat out and went swimming in the Bioluminescent bay which was really cool. Overall it was a very pleasant vacation at the Rincon Beach and for those planning a trip beyond October it will certainly be even better.

Reviews.Title: “not a resort”
Reviews.Author: drman2013
Reviews.Content: We stay from Wed. to Wed. The service was basic, Un-Resort like. At check-in we were charged for our complete stay. I made mention of a room with a view.i was told the room had an Ocean view. the room was one flight up facing the ocean. We were staring at the Coconuts of two palm trees right in front of our balcony. The balcony was useless, because of the hot air of the Air Conditioner filtering onto it. The furniture in the room were showing signs of wear, the desk had a rock, or wobble to it. I was able to fix it with, the old folded piece of paper under one leg. No activities offered aside from the swimming pool, and private beach. Fri./ Sat. night the entertainment was a one man band, in the lobby. A Saxophonist on SFri., and a pianist on Sat.. Oh, there was one ice machine for the two buildings, it was located on the fourth floor, and it stopped working for about two days. The gym was not readily available, you had to request a key, as well as the beach towels and coffee machine. All meals avialable were at a cost, not even free a continental breakfast. Yatta, yatta, yatta!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SylJH
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and clean. The air conditioner didn't work well and it was very hot and humid during our visit. We told the desk about it the second night we were there and after inspecting it they replaced the entire unit very quickly. If you find yourself having that problem don't wait like we did. It wasn't horribly hot in the room just stuffy which is why we didn't call sooner not to mention we weren't in the room until evening the first 2 days. The grounds were very nice however there is some construction going on which their web site states. There was no work going on over the weekend but Monday morning we could hear the sound of hammers. The beach area was wonderful! They do have security and when you check in they give you bands to wear to prove you are guests of the hotel and the security does check it before they let you go to the pool or beach area. The restaurant on the grounds was a bit pricey but the food was very good. The staff was very friendly. Overall we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: pjfrommass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort for three nights over school break with our 13-year-old and 9-year-old. In general, we liked it, and felt it was a good deal. The location was lovely, although it's about a 2-hour drive from San Juan, which can include some tough traffic if you're traveling on a weekday. The staff was nice, the infinity pool was terrific, we liked the food at the restaurant, there was a beautiful beach 3 steps from the pool, and there were some nice amenities (paddle boats, kayaks, ping-pong, 2 giant chess boards, pool bar). We also liked our little patio/balcony for sitting and gazing at the ocean. There was only one breakfast option, a $15 buffet, which was OK but you don't want that much every morning so you might want to head out to one of the nearby bakeries instead. You could get a decent lunch at the pool grille, and the dinner menu included lots of yummy tapas -- even though they didn't do room service, they were fine with packing an order up for you to take back to your room. We REALLY recommend The Shipwreck in Rincon for dinner, and our server recommended The English Rose for breakfast, but we didn't get there. Just to be clear, I couldn't tell from the site, the maps, and these reviews just how far away the beach is -- it's RIGHT THERE. We had a first floor room and we could go out our back door and be at the pool in ten strides, on the beach in 20. That was really nice. When we were there, the ocean was quite warm and calm, and we had pretty sunsets every night. The meh: the resort is under construction, and it shows. We had a great time there, but it makes a very poor impression when you arrive -- plywood and corrugated metal and 2x4s all around the entrance. They should really put up some neutral murals or panels to hide the construction -- wouldn't be hard to do. They had the wrong rate for us when we checked in (too high) but corrected immediately & apologetically when I pointed it out. The room was tired -- lots of scratches/chips on the dark-wood furniture, only one limp pillow per person, broken clock (housekeeping fixed both of these immediately), h/c shower plate spun on the mounting so you couldn't tell where to position the faucet (which didn't matter, since it didn't get very hot anyway), and a vent in the bathroom that emptied straight into the courtyard/walkway so they could hear you and you could hear them, as if you were in the same room. One major problem, about which we and others complained: on the first two of our three nights, they had private functions in the big open courtyard, so guests couldn't use it. Further, the second night the wedding in the courtyard (10 feet from our door) was so loud that we had to turn our TV all the way up to hear it, and that went on until 11. The last night, the courtyard was so lovely we really regretted not having access to it the first two nights. We also paid $75 apiece for 3-hour surfing lessons through Rincon Surf School one day, and drove 30 minutes to Isabela to Tropical Trail Rides for a 2-hour sunset horseback ride on the beach for $45 -- BEAUTIFUL. One of the nicest trail rides I've been on -- lots of beach time, some time in an almond and pine forest, and the horses trot a bit, not just plodding along one after the other. On our way back to San Juan, we visited the Rio Camuy Caves (OK) and the Cagua Ceremonial Park, a site where the native Taino people lived and worshiped for 400 years (simple, but interesting). Overall, we really enjoyed this place and would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LuvAlways
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just wonderful! My husband and I stayed here for our Anniversary. It is close to Rincon Beach. The best part is the pool overlooking into the beach! Breathless! You can also go kayaking for a really low price. The room was clean and the bed was confortable. Did not eat there so I cannot comment on the food. There are restaurants close by. I really loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: coquiOmaha
Reviews.Content: There was construction going on when we were there and the water was turned off for several hours which upset my wife but didn't really bother me and the kids. The pool, beach, and room were great. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was overpriced but there are other dining options nearby. The Mahi Mahi Restaurant and Bar is a couple miles to the east and is very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if there wasn't all that construction.”
Reviews.Author: dinerdiner01
Reviews.Content: Rincon Beach and Resort would have been a great place to stay if they were not undergoing a huge rennovation project. This included driving pipes into the ground with an enormous hammer like construction vehicle (bang, bang, bang) from 9 AM to 5 PM Monday through Friday. Fortunately we were spared this on the weekend. If you are flying into San Juan, better have a rental car. We did, it still took us 2.5 hours to drive to this resort. If I were to go back I would find a way to fly into Auguadilla, which is much closer. I repeat, a rental car is a must. It is also important because the hotel is not in walking distance of any thing that is worthwhile to do. The town of Rincon is a must see for Puerto Rico. There are some nice shops on 115 and especially 413. Check out Maria's Beach, 15 min from the hotel, to see the lighthouse, huge waves, and some good food at Calypso's Cafe. There are some more issues with the resort, such as the lack of services. There is no breakfast in the morning unless you want to pay huge prices at Barassa. The Pellican's Nest claims to open at 10:30 but really doesn't open till 11:30. The bar is rediculously overpriced, especially compared to the deals you can find elsewhere and it closes at 11. The pool closes at 9 PM which leaves you little to do after that. If I were to go to Puerto Rico again, I would skip this resort and stay at The Lazy Parrot.

Reviews.Title: “We were charmed...”
Reviews.Author: MarkOakland
Reviews.Content: ...by the Rincon Beach Resort. We stayed only two nights as we were doing a tour around the perimeter of the whole island. Since we're kind of ADD travelers, that was enough for us, but I can imagine enjoying the place for a while longer. The good: the pool is lovely and right next to the beach. You can spend the day going back and forth from ocean to pool to bar to ocean to pool to bar... The ocean was quite calm, even for February. The restaurant makes a good ceviche. The meh: the room (partial ocean view) was pretty basic and the beds a little sprung. I recommend paying more for one of the rooms that are right on the beach. The hot tub was a warm tub, though I prefer them that way, especially when courting a sunburn. We didn't have any issues with service. Everyone we interacted with was friendly and responsive. It seemed like a family-oriented place but as a gay male couple we felt completely welcome. I did have the sense that the downturn in the economy was starting to affect PR tourism, especially for smaller independent resorts like this one. I'd like to see them stay in business - they have a lot more character than some of the larger places we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business/ Questionable for pleasure. A Hotel without service.”
Reviews.Author: snowbiz100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location in Feb (7-12) 2010. Although the cost ($ 979 for 5 nights) was reasonable, the experience was a real disappointment. The Good: The lobby is open and offers a view of the water. The pools are large and its on the beach The Not so Good: You have to pay for your entire stay upfront. My guess is because most people will want to leave once they see the rooms and experience the lack of service. Rooms are on the older side but OK. Bathrooms are beat up. Housekeeping is minimal, dirt and sand is left on the floor each day , Hair in bathroom upon arrival, etc. Tiny ants included at no additional charge. The hotel has wireless (~10.00), but not from the room. I had to sit in the lobby to get a connection I dropped Laundry off to be pressed and cleaned, it was returned 48 hrs later , but still not washed. The staffs was not surprised, I believe happens often. Fitness center ( 4th floor in a converted guest room) is tiny and you need a special key to get into it ( it took 2 days to get the key from the Front desk. ( key machine broken- deal with it!). Elevator in that building was broken for all 5 days, no effort to have it repaired. The service is terrible. Expect to wait and wait and wait. Restaurant: The restaurant dinner service is painfully slow, and the meals delivered were not correct. The waiter did not check with the table . I stopped eating breakfast due to the delay in getting a cup of tea or a check. Bar Area: Food ordered (after a long delay for an order to be taken) in the bar was delivered without any silverware. Actually had to pull the bartender away from his friends to order a drink (he immediately returned to his discussion and ignored us for the next 90 minutes ). Overall , the staff just couldnâ€™t care less. When you are there you are tolerated, if you leave and never return they are fine with that too ( no guests means they work less so itâ€™s considered by the staff to be a good deal ). I made two attempts to contact managers (Jose Rodrigues and William Crespo). They are never available and although I was told they would contact me, it never happened. Tips If you must stay there, ask for a room with a ocean view and a working elevator. --There are no good alternative restaurants in the area ( the Coach is bad too). Your best bet is to go to the supermarket near Walgreens and get your own food ( the hotel staff is cool with it since you feed yourself and it doesnâ€™t require them to provide food service). --You will need a car, there is nothing in the immediate area. --The beach is littered with broken bottles. Donâ€™t walk without shoes --In order to prevent the room ants from following you home: As soon as you get home, wash everything in your luggage and leave the suitcase in the garage for a few days .

Reviews.Title: “Great in 2007”
Reviews.Author: CSK1
Reviews.Content: This trip was several years ago, but then the beach, room and pool areas were wonderful. The perfect getaway for any family or couple. Rincon Lighthouse is a great sidetrip with beautful views and waves. Be sure to visit there, and bring your surfboard!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: nysarah
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 4 nights at the Rincon Beach Resort and would recommend it highly to anyone, families especially. The beach is practically empty (and steps from the hotel and miles long), the waters calm, the drinks very, very good (especially the Pina Coladas!), the rooms plain but comfortable, and the location terrific. It's about a 10 minute drive from the town of Rincon, but the distance was never a problem for us. I wish I were still by the lovely pool right now.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Boricua-Siempre
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay at the Hotel were great overall. Very few guests make it feel like we were the only ones in the place, and the facilities were very clean. Staff was courteous and met our service expectations. Only one of the bartenders was kind of cranky, but completely changed once we asked her to relax and enjoy the idle time. The kiddie pool and warm big jacuzzi made our days more joyful, and my grandson (2 yrs old) was very happy with both. Beach was clean, no seaweeds or rocks to worry about, and there was plenty of sand to run barefooted and play. The beach was a good mile and half to each side, so morning runs were great, and sunset strolls beautiful. They have a restaurant (Brasas) which have puertorrican cuisine and a nice breakfast buffet with option to have additional omelets and the works. Overall nice experience and will repeat stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Quiet, Quiet...”
Reviews.Author: richmarl10
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rincon Beach Resort, hotel was clean, friendly (not overfriendly) staff. Our room was very nice, on the forth floor, the balcony was only 3 foot wide, was a little disappointed with that, they have larger balcony's on the second floor. The hotel is on the beach but they have so, so many trees, that you can hardly see the ocean, (trees need to be trimed back a bit) the pool was very clean, the beach could be a little cleaner, but it was ok. At 8PM the hotel is dead, there is NO one out!! They have one restaurant, (we did'nt eat there).The food down the road it the BEST. They have the most reasonable, fresh Puerto Rican food. I really like this hotel it is just very quiet, all the nightlife is four miles down the road, which is not that bad, you must rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “loved rincon!”
Reviews.Author: vacationgrl23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the rincon beach resort in early december with my boyfriend and our friends. We very much enjoyed our stay in puerto rico and found rincon to have lots to do and see. The name of the hotel is deceving, if you actually look on a map the hotel is located in a different town called Anesco, which is a ten minute drive to Rincon. We found this to be extreemly annoying as we needed to get in the car (which we did not rent until the second day becuase we thought we would be right in the town) just to go to the surfing spots, grocery store and shops. There is a cheap supermarker called the econo that was helpful to stock up on soda water and even cases of beer. The hotel itself was very clean and mangement did everything they could to accomidate their guests. The hotel is small, you saw the same 10 people at the pool everyday and did not get much variety. There was resturante that served breakfast and dinner and an outdoor grill that served lunch (all were very pricy). Down the street is a empanada place that has $1.00 empanadas, they were delious and cheap. Another place located in the rincon town is Tamboo, it has delious meals, is right on the beach and is a dance club thing at night. The holiday in is off the main road which has a casino that we enjoyed and won from! I recomend getting a car (it was very cheap) when you arrive at the airport. It was a pain to drive back 40 minutes to the airport the following day to rent one as well as pay the cab fee. Rincon and puerto rico itself has lots to see and a car is the best way to do it. We definitly would go back but would rent out a house that was right on the beach on route 413 which is near all the surfing spots next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was there”
Reviews.Author: lilyroth
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that we were pleased from the moment we arrived after our drive from San Juan. The hotel was tropical and the pool and whilpool lovely. The resturant was fabulous. We had a great Thanksgiving buffet with traditional and local twists, a wonderful breakfast and another great dinner. I would eat there every night but one feels compelled to try other restaurants. They had a good live music duo or trio most nights. The staff was very accomodating finding us information on the local baseball teams, for example since we wanted to see a game. The room was very nice and well appointed. How much time do you spend there anyway. I'd go back in the blink of an eye.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot - Service is unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: skeboston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a few days away in December 09. This is our second trip to the resort -- we went back because it is an amazing spot. Rincon is relaxed, beautiful and offer amazing sunsets from its western locale. The resort is clean, safe and nice. The rooms are clean and nice views. There are 2 things that will keep us from going back -- 1) the staff is very, very unfriendly! We are really easy to please, all we want is a few smiles and NO attitude. The bartender hates his job and was so rude to customers. The restaurant is TOO stuffy and snobby. They need to relax and get an island feel to match the location. They have a very small outdated gym!

Reviews.Title: “Do not hold an event here - esp a wedding....”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelette
