Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced and full of overpromises. I attended a wedding here and although the grounds were beautiful the operation of the hotel was awful. Our party was given a "special" room rate but most guests found cheaper deals on hotels.com and travelocity. Everyone in our party was scattered all over the hotel. The bar closed at 10-11pm and when the groom asked the bar tender to stay open he tried to shake him down for $200 in cash. We paid more for a "deluxe" room which was a complete joke - it looked just like the others. When we asked for more towels we were told "there are no more" - how does that happen. These are just a few of the things we encountered in our stay but I am sure you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: fsumathguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights in early December. Let me say up front that we travel alot and we are not picky travellers. First, the good. The staff are great. They are very friendly and willing to help. We arrived in the middle of the night and we were greeted very nicely and our room ready. Everyone at the front desk we spoke to was very nice. They also speak very good english in this area of PR, unlike San Juan where it is more hit or miss. The grounds are very nice. The pool is beautiful and the swin up bar was great. Steps from the pool is your very own beach. The view is beautiful and there are plenty of seats in the shade or the sun. The pool side snack bar had good food and was very reasonably priced. (Side note: There are several stray dogs living on this beach. They are incredibly nice and will become your best friend almost instantly. We bought them food and gave them water each day) Now, the bad. The rooms at this "resort" are incredibly average for the money they charge. Honestly, the rooms are barely above the level of a Motel 6 here in the USA. There were two beds and a tv. Nothing fancy. The rooms are very dated and are not cleaned all that well (although the bedding was clean). The bathrooms are out of date also. We had ants in there the entire time. We live in FL so we understand that pests are a constant problem, but we expected better from a resort like this. We complained to the front desk and they sent someone to spray. That helped but never solved the problem completely. The air conditioner was very loud in the room and woke us up many times. The fridge didn't work and we needed to have them replace it with another. The "ocean view" was not the best view you could have. There are many trees in the way making the view tough. Also, our patio was not covered so in the day it was so bright and hot you could not sit out there. If it rained you were stuck inside. They did have a sunset viewing deck on the top floor, but that kinfdof defeats the purpose of an ocean view room. The onsite restaurant was over priced, we thought, but the food was decent. There are soda machines and an ice machine on site (on the top floor), but there is no where to buy a bottle of water (not the gift shop either). If you stay here I recommend you buy some water/soda/beer and use the fridge. This is cheaper and more convenient. There is a grocery store (Econo) about 5 miles away. Now some points on the area in general. Unlike San Juan, it is not very easy to find your way around here. Addresses are much like the one on the hotels website (a mile marker on a numbered road). The GPS does not do well with this. That being said, there are some great places to go eat/drink in the area if you can find them. Just up the road from the hotel is a great empanada place called Kaplash. Try this for lunch and sit on the ocean view deck. Cheap and wonderful. Another great lunch place is Hacienda Latina in Mayaguez. For dinner we ate at Tamboo and The Spot. Both great places with nice menus. The Spot is a seafood place and is a little pricey, but very good. We went at night but apparently they have a daily happy hour for the sunset also. Things are far away so a rental car is a necessity here. Just make you get get good directions from the hotel staff or you will certianly get lost. All in all we had a wonderful time, but unfortunately it has little to do with this particular resort. I am not sure what other choices there are in the area, but I would look around a bit. I do highly recommend this part of PR, but I think for the money you should be able to do better than this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Hs163
Reviews.Content: Staff sucks, food sucks and service really sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DelawareSofie
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome deal on our room, so the price was perfect! I could see if you paid over $200 you would be disapointed. The rooms were clean, the grounds were beautiful, the pool was great, the bay warm, not the best for snorkling : ( water is not crystal clear and if it was, there isn't much to see, good swimming beach! Bring your own shampoo, etc if you are picky. The food was good, but we rented a car, and ate at different restaurants each night. Loved the Ship Wreck in Rincon. Bottom line, If you are looking for a an all inclusive pampering resort, or if you are the type of person who complains about trivial things like the staff didn't kiss your but then this is not the place for you. If you want a resort with a great pool, great swimming beach close to Rincon then you've found it.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this resort”
Reviews.Author: LadyMIs19
Reviews.Content: Terrible staff, horrible beds, awful views, surprise charges, ants in the bathroom, no amenities.... need I say more. This place cliams to be a resort but its certaibnly not. Dont be fooled by the pics or the higher prices thinking you'll get more than a crappy hotel wih itchy bedding and horrible amenities. Doesnt even provide hair conditionaer and I think the shampoo is the same as the bath gel. Alternatively, stay at Villa Co Fresi - its not a resort either but at least you pay for what you get and its friendly with a better restaurant/bar!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Island Beach Hotel with all the modern necessities”
Reviews.Author: MEGinFL
Reviews.Content: I loved the open air lobby. Here there was a wonderful sitting area, a lobby bar, and wireless internet. It's a great place to sit in the evening, feel the cool ocean breeze and plow through your daily email. Add a mojito to it and you could almost forget you had business to conduct. The room I stayed in was spacious and was in the style of the island. The floors were terra cotta tile throughout, so make sure you bring slippers or socks. The floor is cold, which is an enormous blessing in a hot climate. I slept quite comfortably in the evening with the window open and was lulled to sleep by the sound of the native coqui. The beds were comfortable too. The restaurant was very nice. It has typical Mainland and European inspired menu. Personally, I was disappointed that they didn't offer more traditional Borriquen food. I would have loved to have Carney Frita y Mofongo. Alas, I had to go to a local restaurant for that. However, the food was very good and reasonably priced. The decor was island rustic, which I loved. Be forwarned, if you crave "luxury" in the typical Mainland or European style, this may not be the hotel for you. But if you want upscale island style, this is the place. I loved this hotel and hope to be able to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “PAlm trees, Pool, Beach, Pina Coladas, Music: A Real Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BABOSA123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort and it was beautiful. I went with my kids and they had a great time. I was able to enjoy the pool and beach during the day and at night I relaxed listening to a live singer. I loved all the singers that came ( a different one for a couple of nights). I loved it. I recommend this hotel to couples and to those with kids only. The employees of the hotel were really nice and accommodating. The room I got had a really nice view, it was spacious and clean. The food was a little costly and to reach another restaurant was quite a ride to the main road. But, this was a great vacation, not one of us wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Peace & Quiet on a Nice Calm Beach”
Reviews.Author: Monsoon66
Reviews.Content: We were at the RBR for 4 nights after being in San Juan's Condado Beach. It was our first trip to Puerto Rico. Being early-to-mid-July, it was pretty darn hot when sightseeing in Old San Juan. It was a nice relief to come to the peace and quiet of the RBR. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the RBR and would come back to it again. The woman who handled our check-in said there were no rooms with two beds left despite our online reservation for a two-bed room. She offered us a room with a king bed. Once in the room, we heard noise from the adjacent room through the (locked) adjoining door, so we went back to the reception, talked to a man who was now at the front desk, and asked for another room. Miraculously, now they had rooms with two beds available, not one but two! Huh? Ten minutes ago the woman said the hotel was full (which we found out from other hotel staff later was not the case) and she had absolutely nothing else left, now the man helping us offered us two rooms to choose from. We're grateful that they accommodated our noise concerns, but we couldn't help but think that the first woman did not honor our online reservation for the two-bed room when she could have. Once we got a room change, everything was smooth from there on. The room was comfortable and spacious and fairly clean. I said "fairly clean" because each day we would find several new long black hairs in our room that could not have come from either of us. We believe they might have come from the cleaning staff, so wearing a hairnet would be our recommendation to make their work more efficient. Another downside of the room is that we could hear furniture moved back and forth in the room above, because chairs in the room have legs made of iron and the floors are tiled. We resolved the problem by wearing ear plugs every night. It's a drag to wear ear plugs, but they did the job and we had good sleep. Enough with the minor complaints, now the compliments. The hotel's grounds were very well kept and the beach was right there. They did a good job grooming the plants and cleaning the beach. The pools were also attractive, overlooking the beach. The hotel's architecture is a colonial Spanish style, and is in very good shape as if it has been recently renovated. The flowers and trees in the gardens were gorgeous and well tended (see the trees with red blossom in the courtyard). Staff was friendly and helpful (except for the female staff member at reception we first encountered). Wireless Internet access in the lobby and courtyard area. I was thankful that the hotel did not play loud music in the public areas like many other resorts do at the pool. This allowed guests to enjoy their own music using their own private music players. We heard that July was when Puerto Rican families took vacation, and the guests at the hotel we saw seemed confirm that. Lots of families with kids, but the children were all behaving reasonably well for public areas (I am not a big fan of loud, rowdy children running around). Beach: Let's not forget the beach-the biggest asset of the resort. The beach is a reasonably long gentle crescent-shaped beach that is clean and quiet. I went for runs in the morning (7-8 a.m.) and hardly saw anyone else. The next beach over was easily accessible by the public, and on weekends we saw local people hanging out there in the evening, enjoying the water and the sun. Still, that was relatively far from the RBR, and RBR guests would feel as if they are on a private beach. Next door to RBR is a condo building, but it was not a big development and there were very few people coming from there, and their staff tidied up their portion of the beach. This makes the beach at RBR quiet, clean, and peaceful. Nice vegetation on beach and very calm water made the beach the star of our vacation--a tropical paradise that we'd dreamed of visiting. Food & Drinks: We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant one night. It was good but nothing spectacular. The price was high, but reasonable for an out-of-the-way resort, and compared to the surprisingly high prices in other restaurants we went to in PR, it was not prohibitively expensive. It is worth it if you want convenience or did not have a car. We went shopping at local supermarkets (5-10 minutes drive in either direction from the hotel) and bought beverages and chilled them in the in-room refrigerator. This saved us a lot of money, and we were able to drink our beverages on the beach and the pool area. We had lunch ordered poolside, and it was a decent cheeseburger with the price towards the high side but not exorbitant. Other attractions: - Drive north to Rincon (10-15 minutes) for restaurants and supplies. In July, it was like a ghost town, but we imagined a different vibe when surf's up. - Drive south to Cabo Rojo to see the salt flat, have lunch at the beautiful Parador Bahia Salinas, and swim at the lovely beach called Playuela near the lighthouse which is popular among local sun-and-sea lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: nwildgirl5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort for a week in October last year when we came to visit his family. It was my first trip to Puerto Rico so I wasn't sure what to expect. When I came across Rincon Beach Resort online I fell in love instantly and booked the room just as quick! We arrived at the hotel about midnight and couldn't believe the hotel was even better then the pics! I will say we did have trouble finding the place at first because it is what other have said "off the beaten path" but we didn't mind. The hotel was so tropical! We loved our room (Superior rm) and had a view of the Palm trees and pool/beach. We only ate once at their restaurant because we were always on the move pretty early in the morning but I wish we had eaten there everyday. Breakfast was so delicious,ample and affordable! The pool area was beautiful. We spent our last day there hanging on the beach kyaking and swimming in the pool. You definately need a car but I found that is anywhere you stay in PR you drive everywhere. The staff was great! They were so helpful and answered any questions I had. We were there when Hurricane Omar was thought to hit us (thankfully it didn't) and the staff kept us updated. Housekeepers were wonderful. Our room was so clean and kept that way everytime we came back to the room at the end of the day. A.C. was the best. It was so humid when were there and it felt great to walk into an icebox when we got back! We cannot wait to go back again! There is so much more for us to do and see and staying at the Rincon Resort has us in the middle of everywhere we want to go. We are definately coming back again!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyhammock
Reviews.Content: I will agree with other reviews in saying that the staff was very helpful, but that was the only positive experience with this hotel we can speak of. First, the "resort" is dated and more than just "off the beaten path." After fighting 3 hours of traffic in Puerto Rico, you arrive at the hotel and the first thing you see is the run down tennis courts. Parking is several yards from the hotel itself, where theft is a problem. We traveled with another couple, and here is a list of problems we had with our rooms: 1. TV's did NOT work in either room. This must not have been an isolated incident as there were several guests gathered in the lobby watching tv. 2. Toilet did not flush in our room. 3. Phones did NOT work in either room. 4. There were dead bugs in the bathrooms and on the floor. 5. We were supposed to have a King bed, they gave us 2 double beds. 6. Ocean view? Not so much. If you stretch you might catch a glimpse after looking over the other buildings, playground, and pool. 7. There are very few eateries in the area and they are pricey, one couple we spoke w/ had eaten at the same place every night for a week. 8. The floors in the rooms were just gross! They were visibly dirty. 9. One of the elevators did not work and according to other guests it had been down the prior week also. 10. The Beach: If are you looking for white sandy beaches this is NOT the place for you. The beach is literally brown, while the water is far from clear. I will say the pool was decent but is advertised as an infinity pool which it most certainly is not. The bugs here are HUGE and EVERYWHERE as the lobby is open-air. If after this, you still choose to vaca. in Rincon, you will need a rental car. There is absolutely nothing within walking distance. We stayed one night out of the entire week's vacation and paid extra to book a flight and hotel in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice, Staff needs to be replaced”
Reviews.Author: mactampaFL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a week 5/11 to 5/16, for work. We booked the hotel through my wife's travel department. Her department was told $119+tax when we arrived we were told it was 130+tax. Ok not a big deal just the point. When we asked about it, the women checking us in stated that she made the rev. and we were wrong about the price. Though when we had called and talked to Stephanie Ramirez, right after the stay was booked she also told us it was 119+tax and the room had an ocean view. Having traveled since 4 am and it was now 5pm, we were not going to fight over 11 bucks. When we got to the room there was no view all you could see was a palm tree that was blocking the window. We asked to be moved and we were. The hotel is nice, needs some painting and upkeep but nothing too bad. Pool was nice, Beach was clean. There was a bar that you could swim up to in the pool that was never opened the whole time we were there. The Bartender was great i wish i could remember his name but i guess one of the signs of a good bartender is not remembering :) The restaurant staff was also helpful and very nice. The Front desk staff was just awful the whole trip. When we arrived we had to wait for the 2 women to stop talking about their weekend before they even checked us in. They were talking in Spanish and guess they thought my wife did not speak Spanish. We wanted to go to dinner that night and asked if the front desk staff had any ideas. Only 1 guy even answered us. There were 4 people working. When we asked for a map of the area, we were told they did not have one. I found one on the front desk in a holder. They did not even acknowledge us, they just went back to talking. We were never greeted when we came in or left. Any time we went to the desk it felt like you were bothering them just being there. On the last day we were checking out. Again we were not greeted, asked how our stay was, anything. My wife asked for a water, the woman looked at her and then went right back to checking us out like she did not hear her. She was training someone, and took 10-15 min to check out. She did not say anything to us about it. Did not ask if it was ok to train her, if we were in a hurry or anything. After we paid, the woman turned her back to us to talk to another woman that worked there that had walked in wearing sunglasses, asking why she had them on in here. The woman in the glasses went on about how drunk she was from the night before. The woman that checked us out never said goodbye, we were done, nothing. All in all if you want a place to relax and do not need anything from the staff it is an ok place. If you need any service at all this is not the place for you. Since this is a service industry, no matter how nice the property is, if the service is this bad it ruins the whole trip. Service is one of the most important things about a hotel, and can make or break the experience. I am a very easy traveler and have only ever wrote 1 other bad review and that was about The Princess hotel in Belize City, if you have been there you truly understand. Before going i read all the reviews about how good the staff was and realy hoped for a good trip. This was the first trip my wife and I have been able to take in 10 years and we had hoped it would be so much better than it was.

Reviews.Title: “I wanna go back!”
Reviews.Author: iblisa
Reviews.Content: Perfect romantic getaway! Great rooms, great view, great beach, great staff....absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “what a deal!”
Reviews.Author: jerray
Reviews.Content: We booked here through hotels.com at a price of $95 per night, and didn't expect too much for this price. When we first arrived, the room safe didn't work, the air conditioner didn't work, and several other little things didn't work (like window latches, TV cabinet closure,and the tub drain stopper) We decided to concentrate on the important air conditioner and safe ,and reported these to the front desk. We were assured these things would be fixed promptly, but we really didn't believe it., as the hotel seemed really busy. Within 2 hours, they had fixed the safe and actually replaced the AC with a different one that worked! That is fast service and we were impressed! The hotel beach is very nice for swimming or long walks. We felt safe. Plenty of shade palms if you need them. The pool is very clean and beautiful. The lobby areas are beautiful and well landscaped. The staff was very quick to accomodate any request. The beach towels are really thick and nice, and it's easy to "trade" your sandy wet ones for nice fresh ones. The first 2 days we were there, we were afraid the hotel restaurant would be too expensive for breakfast, so we ate elsewhere. The third day, we decided to look at the menu, and the prices were affordable, so we tried it. The breakfasts were huge, delicious, attractive, and the coffee was included.!!! For $7.50, you could get an omelette, choice of meats, toast, potatoes, fruit, and coffee. For $6.50 we got the almond french toast with fruit and coffee. It came with whipped cream, and a delicious guava butter, and the bread used to make it was like a homemade french bread. All this, and ....a beautiful view, white linens, nice china and flatware and great service, We couldn't believe we had "wasted" the first 2 days eating elsewhere trying to save a buck. Needless to say, we ate there every day after that. One thing I think this hotel could improve on is that the room was dusty. It got mopped daily, clean sheets, bathroom cleaned, etc. daily. But - the ceiling fan, furniture, chairs, picture frames, and headboard, all were full of dust when we arrived, and never got cleaned. We tipped daily, and overall the maid service was good, but they really do need to invest in some Endust and a duster. Overall, this hotel was a great deal for the price and we were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “A truely relaxing experience.”
Reviews.Author: creedboston
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relaxing low keyed vacation spot with a beautiful setting, this is the place for you. The hotel is located right on the beach. The beach is perfect for small children, because there are no big waves. The hotel is really preety, loved the open courtyard with swaying palm trees. The pool looks like it flows right into the ocean. The staff is not overly friendly, but they were polite. The food at hotel restaurant was descent, but expensive. They need to replace the cloth chairs, they were stained. That grossed me out.. Once we got our bearings, we ate at some fantatic restaurants in Rincon. They don't look like much,but food is fantastic. These are our top places,,The Shipwreck, The Rincon Tropical, order the rice and shrimp, and sweet plantains. The other place is The Spot.. The beach and pool got a little boring for the kids, so we went snorkeling. I heard the horesback riding is teriific but we never did that. we went to the caves awesome , but very long trip. Overall we loved our vacation..

Reviews.Title: “Not as luxurious as it makes out!”
Reviews.Author: dinopcv10
Reviews.Content: Rincon Beach Resort advertises itself as if it is incredibly luxurious. Whilst the pool and beach area and external property appearence are fit for this description I would not apply the same to the rooms and service. The room smelt damp and there are a lot of fixtures that are not of a high standard or well maintained. For example the bath has big scratches in it and the curtains have mould spots. If the resort did not set expectations so high then the room would have been perfectly ok but it is just a little disappointing. The service was not really friendly or professional. For example, our wake up call was 15 minutes late! You don't get the feeling that the staff want to help you, it seems like it is too much effort for them! However, the beach is totally beautiful, clean and not busy and the pool area is pretty nice! There is a good sense of privacy and safety. I would not pay the same amount to stay here again, either need to drop the price or increase the quality. Whilst in Puerto Rico we stayed in several other places that were cheaper and of a much higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden treasure of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ashwad918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married here just over 2 weeks ago, and it could not have been more perfect. Many times going to a website, a resort puts up pictures that are false to what you truly get....but not in this case! It was beautiful. It was a very relaxing and enjoyable place to be. It is gated so we always felt safe, and the staff was friendly!! The food is wonderful. Our reception menu couldn't have been better!!! They exceeded my expectations of my wedding and it was a beautiful place. It is a great place for a vacation if you love to relax, and enjoy the beach. We had family that joined us for the occasion and they loved the place as well!! It is a great place to get to be together and relax!! The bar can make a GREAT margarita!! The town of Rincon is not far (10 minutes max), and it was fun to ask the locals what was fun and the good places to eat!! No, it is not the hustle and bustle of San Juan, but it is a WONDERFUL place for a get away, and we most definately will be back for future vacations!!!! I highly recommend a rental car, it is nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent choice for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: MrT69
Reviews.Content: Very impressive beachside hotel with an experienced and accomodating staff. Beachside just outside of the resort town allowing total relaxation in a child-safe environment. Beautiful pool with an array of activities for children including ping pong, playground area, kayaks, etc.. Very relaxing. Staff was remarkable from arrival to departure. Rooms come with a refrigerator and a safe.

Reviews.Title: “The Rincon Beach Resort is a sparkling gem”
Reviews.Author: lulou77
Reviews.Content: The resort is right on the ocean with plenty of beach to walk, search for shells, relax or get a bit of exercise. The room had a queen size bed and a bathroom. I would have to say we did not extend our stay by a day due to the amenities, but more due to the fantastic location. We had the most relaxing time at this hotel. When we return to Puerto Rico we will also be returning to the Rincon Beach resort. The business center had one computer which was available most of the time. Breakfast is not included in your stay, but they have an on site restaurant which has a buffet or menu for breakfast. By the pool and ocean they have an on site grill. We hope some day to return to the Rincon Beach Resort

Reviews.Title: “Excellent when traveling with children”
Reviews.Author: aventura6707
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in AÃ±asco, just a couple of minutes away from the RincÃ³n surfing beaches. However, because it's on the Caribbean Sea and not the Atlantic Ocean, the waters are extremely calm, making it the perfect setting for families with smaller kids. The hotel is quite charming and the staff extremely friendly and accomodating. The room was clean and the restaurant food was very good. The pool is small but well planned and mantained. We've stayed at other hotels/inn in the area, and I would definitely return to this one. It may not be the most value-oriented, but I felt safe, and the kids had a great time. The sunsets are incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Our return family visit was very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: dlloydg_9
Reviews.Content: It's a big world, and my wife and I once vowed we'd never make a return trip to a winter vacation spot. We happily broke that vow this winter, and are glad we did. After a very pleasant 2005 stay with two small children (then aged 6 and 5), we returned to the Rincon Beach Resort last month (with the active encouragement of our daughters, who had fond memories of the hot tub and mango smoothies at the swim-up pool bar), and found that the hotel just as pleasant as before. The grounds are immaculate, self-contained and smallish, which affords children the luxury of roaming with minimal supervision. The setting is quiet and very peaceful, on a long crescent of undeveloped beach - excellent for walks. The pool, large hot tub and gentle surf beach are well-maintained and ideal for children and grown-ups alike. The service is friendly and unobtrusive. We were particularly grateful that the staff allowed us to downgrade from a suite to a smaller room, which better met our budget and needs this time around. The rooms are fine, if unexceptional, and have refrigerators for snacks or small meals. Aside from a small playground and oversized chess boards, there's not too much to do (the resort charges for kayaks and paddle boats), but none of us minded the quiet, and we easily passed six tranquil days in this oceanside paradise. The poolside snack bar serves good lunch fare at reasonable prices; the restaurant is a bit pricey and our meals there were just average, but Rincon is just five minutes away, and a good alternative for dinner and wave watching. The gym is average at best, but who wants to be inside with a beautiful beach beckoning. All in all, we'd recommend this small resort highly for folks who crave a calm and sunny respite from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool and beach, average to below guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: ackz
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old daughter and I stayed four nights at the Rincon Beach Resort. Upon arriving at our room, we found that the supposed "ocean view" was really palm trees and the pool bar area, with a small speck of water through the trees. The staff was apologetic, but insisted that it was indeed an ocean view. We moved to a room with two double beds that had a view of the condo parking lot next door, the children's play area and a wider speck of water beyond, which turned out to be a good move; although the front desk correctly told us that the pool bar closes at 5pm, they neglected to mention that that area is used for corporate entertainment, complete with loud and not very good music. The room itself was tired. The bath was tiny and not as clean as it could or should have been. Housekeeping was responsive to our request for extra towels and pillows, which we received very quickly. The pool area is lovely, clean and beautifully landscaped, a great place for a late afternoon drink. The beach is also very nice, although not as well maintained as it ought to have been; by Monday it was littered with cigarette butts, sticks and other small debris, with bird poo on a number of the lounge chairs. The staff seemed to keep up better on the weekend, which was substantially busier. We also enjoyed the restaurant, which had excellent breakfast and dinner menus. This was a pleasant suprise. The area around the resort has a good number of fun things to do. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but would not return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful once situated”
Reviews.Author: qwertynyc
Reviews.Content: We went here on a 4 day trip to relax and get away from it all. After a long trip and drive from San Juan we wanted to walk into our beautiful room and let the relaxation begin. We had reserved a deluxe ocean view room with king sized bed, and walked into a bare bones room with two double beds and no ocean view. We immediately spoke with the front desk and they switched us to the original room we reserved. We were still disappointed with the wear and tear throughout the room. The bathrooms were a bit tiny and antiquated. Most importantly, the room did not have an ocean view.. more like a palm tree view. We returned to the front desk and spoke with a manager. He apologized, and quickly upgraded us to a Jr. Suite which was a relief, as it was MUCH nicer. But please do not take this as a bad experience at all! The pool was crystal clear, the sunsets were gorgeous, the location was convenient and the staff was quite pleasant. If you're ordering food, sit outside and get a Medalla Light beer and the Mamposteado Rice! As a final note, the hotel could use some upgrades, or at least some accessorizing throughout the rooms. Otherwise, everything else was wonderful. If you can afford the Jr. Suite then we would certainly recommend staying here, unless you just want a quick getaway in a bare-bones room.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: Carmen-Carteret4910
Reviews.Content: It's a nice place but I think it needs some activitie to do at might. The pool closes early, it needs some light at night (by the pool),needs a live band or at least music so that at night you dont have to go somewhere else to listen to music or dance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, the landscaping is superb!”
Reviews.Author: mariemanati_PR
Reviews.Content: This was intended to be an early anniversary weekend (my husband was leaving the country to serve in the army overseas). We got there at 8:30 pm, the check-in was pleasant. We had a deluxe room w/ a king size bed, no balcony or view from the room, but if you want a breathtaking viewe, just go to the lobby and look at the pool and the beach. They both seem to be next to each other. When we got to the room I noticed that some of the lamps did not have bulbs, so called front desk and in less than five minutes our small problem was resolved. The only complaint that I have is that there is no carpet, and the floor gets too cold to walk barefoot. and there should be more pillows, 'cause one small pillow is not good enough to watch tv. Let's talk about the food, la brassa rest. serves delicious breakfast buffet. You start with fresh fruits, yogurt w/granolla, oatmeal, english muffins, then you have scramble eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, sausages, pancakes, cold cereal, juice and coffee. With this breakfast you can skip lunch, as we did. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We went to Cabo Rojo to El Combate Beach, and ate at Joyuda, its not far from Mayaguez. Overall we had a wonderful weekend. I would absolutely go back, well when my husband comes from the Middle East.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Breathtaking and a very nice place to be at and relax!”
Reviews.Author: RiveraSanchez
Reviews.Content: I travel 70% of the time each month! And I have experienced many excellent hotels... but what caught my attention from this hotel was the first impression as you walk in the Lobby!!! It took my breath away... Simply a little paradise. The hotel is prime property surrounded by same resort residences. My room was very nice although no balcony in my rate range but it was still very worth it! No INTERNET in the Rooms, but good reception in the Lobby. The Reception handled by young guys but bearable. Staff is good as they pay attention. I loved the location... Easy to find from #2 Highway. Plus great places to each around the hotel. Nice! Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Resort!”
Reviews.Author: charliechoo2
Reviews.Content: Relaxing, beautiful setting. Wonderful pool right at the ocean's edge. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Excellent food in the restaurant. I would go back to this resort in a heartbeat. I met lots of travelers and we all loved our choice. I had one of the most relaxing weeks of my life. Lots of fun things to do in a close proximity. I was able to boogie board and scuba at nearby locations. But I almost always ended my night by relaxing in the jacuzzi with a cocktail from the bar. My travel companion and I highly recommend this place for a week of pure bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This one”
Reviews.Author: susiecruiser
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say We went to this hotel family of 4. Our Plane was late so our Sister got the key for us. When we arrived there was no one at the front desk we went to our room, VERY TIRED, and wanted to sleep, Room smelled very musty, this is most likely due to the tropics but had this smell, IF your asthmatic I would not go there. BUT after pulling the covers down and finding a infestation of ANTS there was no way we were going to stay. So we went to the FARO that was close to the airport and it was A-1 The management would not refund our money for the rest of the stay, We would have paid for the first day, HOWEVER this was not a cancellation it was due to BUGS and smell. Travel Agent called also and the manager was not budging so I could not recommend this one. BUt Highly recommend the Faro.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation - ONLY”
Reviews.Author: traveliteVA
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here when we did due to a "Come On" by Expedia that if we booked by Friday @ midnight Pacific Time we'd get a $100 gas card. I saw their "Ad" one night in July. I spent several hours checking reviews and comparing things and started through the online booking process. By 11:30 PM Eastern Time I was just putting in my credit card info when Expedia's site went down! They had a little page up that said, "Sorry! Working on the site - Come back tomorrow" So I did. I booked it, but no reference to the gas card so I called and they SAID they would honor the gas card, but they never did. Repeated emails went totally ignored. THEREFORE: Being on a tight budget, we didn't drive around the island much. Rincon Beach Resort, as the previous writer said, was beautiful, but it was completely quiet which WAS what we wanted in our stay. We also had the good luck that the pool bar and outdoor grill bar were open most of the times we were at the pool. (We were there August 22 through August 29: The bars and even the pool are going to be closed in early September!). We noticed that things did tend to close anyway when it rained each day, so if you were there between say 3 PM and 6 PM it might be closed for the latter part of the bars' hours. Also, August is not "high season" (August in the Carribean..duh) so there weren't probably enough customers to justify opening much later. Many times it was just us two at the pool side bar for example, and we just ordered our one beer. Things to do: They do have QUIET activities on site: Plaza bar and TVs, exercise room, Giant Chess boards, tennis, golf putting green and we saw children on the playground. Also sailing and kayaking rentals are available there. Friends we met at the RBR did a heck of a lot, however. (Bigger budget, I guess!) They went snorkeling, zip-lining, to the luminescent bay explored a festival in Ponce and shopping in Rincon and Mayaguez.; however as the previous review said that's all outside and beyond the resort. We did wander to Arecibo (observatory - good for astronomy enthusiasts) Rincon (a few quaint shops). The Lazy Parrot was completely dead when we went @ 5 PM one weekday, although the Calypso Cafe around the corner was hopping! We had a great meal at the Harbour Restaurant and watched a storm off in the distance over the water while we ate (snapper good, mahi-mahi not so much) in the enclosed air conditioned restaurant. All in all, a nice place to go if you want to just chill and relax. Very VERY comfortable - even in August! Great Breezes (at the Resort - not off site!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: Bailey58
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel off the beaten path. Walked for a mile on the beach and only saw 2 people. Housekeeping staff pleasant but cannot communicate well if you only speak english. Kept asking for 2 washcloths for bathroom and each day we would get three towels and one washcloth. Had to race to the shower each morning to keep my wife guessing. Beware of the snack bar. Ate lunch and the waitress came over and asked if we would like a refill on our soda's. The three refills and the two original soda's came with a price tag of $20. a bit pricey. Allow ample travel time for meals. There were no other restaurants, outside of the hotel's, in close proximity. Scenery makes up for a lot of the shortfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Boring!!!”
Reviews.Author: mzmelinda
Reviews.Content: First the good: This "resort" looks good in photos, rooms are basic yet clean, pool is ok, beach front is ok, clear water, although not blue water. Now the bad: BORING, BORING, BORING!!! until the last day of our stay, the pool side bar and pool side grill were closed, deathly quiet except birds and frogs, no light festive music in backgrouind at all. Jacuzzi had cold water, most ocean view balconies are blocked by palm trees, the sun sets past a mountain that blocks that view, so you have to drive more westward to catch it. Bartenders could not make a decent drink, no one knew what a martini was. On-site restaurant pricey with bad tasting food. Staff quick to have an "I don't know look" when asked about lack of amenities, I actually heard one tell another guest, the pool bar will open when they have customers, he was like "we are customers!" Bottom line: didn't feel like a resort at all, felt like a hotel. Thank Goodness we rented a car, we left the resort daily trying to find things to do and decent food to eat. Only used the resort to sleep, except the last day when everything was finally open. By the way, you will find the West side of the island is more rustic and laid back in general. Many roads are not well marked, most places do not have actual addresses! We had to use GPS, iphone google maps and the paper map from the visitor guide to locate places to visit, and even so, many times were lost, however we actually still had fun exploring. So honestly, if the Rincon Beach resort had been more pleasurable, we probably wouldn't have explored as much and had as much fun, but next time if I just need somewhere to sleep, I could have saved a lot of money elsewhere. By the way, The Lazy Parrot had a cool atmosphere and nice restaurant, but if you are looking for 4-5 stars, it's probably not for you. Honest rating for Rincon Beach resort would be 2.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Coqui55
Reviews.Content: Small resort but very nice. The rooms and the pool needs remodeling. However, the staff was very pleasant. We enjoyed the beach very much. They are remodeling the place in September 08, so after that it should be very nice. The restaurant is very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “NIce, but only secluded for Monday to Friday mornings!”
Reviews.Author: Blcakcats2
Reviews.Content: Our vacation started at this hotel and we found that it is nice enough to stay for a brief period. We stayed from Wednesday until Saturday morning and we were glad to be checking out then. Our experience evidenced that until late Thursday afternoon ... early evening, guests recieve the attention of the hotel staff; however, this all changes with the arrival of the "San Juan" crew. Late Thursday's into Friday the hotel becomes very busy with the arrival of young (20's to 30's and possibly 40's) professioinals from San Juan who come to party!!!!!! The hotel staff issues blue bands for all guest to wear, the police begin to partol the beach via boat and horsebac k and hotel security is increased to be very visisble. Unfortunately, as the "San Juan" crew unwinded, the Friday evening noise rose and continued until 3:00 am with loud arguments, audible shouted profanity in the hallways outside bedrooms, breaking glass, and inoperable elevators to contend with the following morning. A word to the wise, if you go, book your vacation to leave on (or by) Friday morning and head back to San Juan to enjoy the fine dining, casinos and clubs found there since you will not sleep well due to the noise ongoing outside your room. Good things to say about the resort.....enjoy breakfast every day in the hotel's restaurant. Everything was very good, prepared correctly, bountiful, restocked quickly, and the coffee was enjoyable. In fact, breaksfast was so large, you could almost skip lunch with a quick snack later on. Use the pool in the morning and head to the beaches in the afternoon. Also, see Rincon, drive the roads and seek out the other beaches in the area.....Tres Hermanos is the last of the surfing beaches and is well worth the trip. Enjoy a late snack or early dinner at Tamboo. Tamboo sits right on the beach, a great palce to watch the waves and they welcomed many a drenched customer who came in to escape a sudden downpour. The staff did not make a fuss regarding the hassle of taking in refugees, moved tables to make room for all, offerred towels to dry people off, and never once made a guest feel that they had overstayed their welcome while the rain continued. Also. seek out Casa Islena Inn in Rincon (it is locted near Tamboo). This island inn offers an excellent Tapas bar in late afternoon, which was wonderful. One last comment about Rincon Beach Resort .... a previous reviewer had mentioned that all rooms are Garden Rooms. However, this is not true. Our room was 459, which overlooked tha parking lot thus receiving some highway noise and it did not have a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't horrible/Wasn't Great”
Reviews.Author: herrera139
Reviews.Content: Just got back a few days ago - nice hotel on attractive property. Staff was good. Beach very nice, especially during the afternoon hours when you just wanted to sit on the lounge chair and watch the sun go down. Rooms were nice, not spectacular, average. If you are truly looking for down time with nothing to do, this area of Rincon will suit you fine. Sleepy town, no fancy restaurants, not very well built up. My issue with beach and pool area not well kept. Leftover plates of food, used towels, etc... it wasn't a total dump, but wasn't nice to see. The staff should really be on top of keeping the area clean. If possible fly into a local airport - the 2 1/2 drive from San Juan is very long and this resort is not worth the drive. You can find a resort just as nice or nicer with half the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: maggy376
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Rincon Beach Resort for my sister's Wedding. We really loved the location, the views are absolutely beautiful! Our pictures were amazing, the sunset was breathtaking. The pool was very nice as well. Unfortunately, we did not have the oppurtunity to sit for dinner, however while out having fun on the beach we ordered tasty empanadas and other light appetizers.....they were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “very little service at Rincon Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Trish07Colorado
Reviews.Content: The location of the Rincon Beach Resort is beautiful and peaceful. However, there is almost no service, the staff was very unfriendly. We were in two different rooms and it appears they all need a really good cleaning. The drapes were dirty with hand prints and looked as though they hadn't been cleaned in several years.

Reviews.Title: “Beloved jewel beginning to tarnish”
Reviews.Author: BillyJoe62
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at Rincon Beach Resort for vacation over several years (7+ yrs). We have found the Junior Suites rooms that are poolside to be quite nice (or at least nicer) and have generally enjoyed the out of the way, quiet location. However, this time we booked a 2 room suite in the tower. The room was quite large, but the furnishings are VERY worn out. The room smelled very musty (it was mold in the furnishings) and they had to spray the room daily to keep the odor down. From the different rooms that I've stayed in, I don't sense that furnishings have been updated at all in any rooms that I have stayed in over the years since the hotel opened (significant scratches on wood furniture, subtle tears in curtains, worn fabrics on seating,...). THis was a radical difference from the quality of the San Juan Marriott (very high quality) that we stayed at this time as well - not what I expect from a Rincon Beach Resort that touts it's acclaimed amenities. (also, can't compare "western" style service to this. You've gone native here - service can be indifferent - very uneven standards - it's a "boutique"!) On the outside, the setting is very pretty and grounds and exterior are generally well maintained. The pool is the largest and deepest that we've found on the west coast of Puerto Rico. My son likes the small deep end (~5-6 ft). Most pools around the area are small and have no deep end. BUT: * The pool STILL has EXTENSIVE black algae problems - they DO NOT maintain the pool well. * One day we were there, the jacuzzi was deep green! THey didn't bother closing it. Another algae problem that they reduced by the next day, but SHEESH! Also, if you book when there is a major event occurring, events are held in the open courtyard. The week we were there they had a film festival (nice) and a wedding. The wedding party had EXTREMELY LOUD music that ran past 11PM and reverberated throughout the rooms (most rooms face the courtyard). Definitely disturbing - typical - it's happened on at least 2 of our stays. The two bedroom suite was NOT worth the money. Bottom Line - * Stick with Jr Suite, * avoid school vacation times, * expect local crush on wkends, * expect low key, quiet surroundings, * pray for no special events because the noise is stifling * hope they fix the pool problems/maintenance * hope they upgrade the worn out furnishings (don't count on it) * lunch menu at the cafe is good and reasonably priced * dinner is nice but overpriced. head out. * not too exciting for teens (nothing really to do), unless you take them up the road to surf

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: PhxED
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this resort is the restaurant. The food is truly exceptional and I would go out of my way just to have dinner here. Also, the staff is very helpful and friendly. On the downside, the quality and maintanance level of accomodation depends on which room you get -- I started in a beach front that had peeling paint and crumbling stucco and ended up in a room that was perfect...not sure why the variation. The resort itself is very small with a nice but small pool area and a so-so beach. With that said, this is the best resort on the west side of Puerto Rico unless you can make it to the Villa Montana in Isabella.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go-not worth it”
Reviews.Author: jerb1227
Reviews.Content: The hotel is NOT in Rincon. The rooms were old, dingy, not kept up. The toilet broke the 1st day and the TV was from the 80's. I was told the continental breakfast wasn't included AFTER I got there. My upgraded ocean view room looked over a pool for the condos next door. This hotel is listed as a Sterling hotel, but is not. I just wanted to check out and leave, which is what I did. I paid a penalty ,but it was worth it to get out of there. STAY AT THE RINCON OF THE SEAS. That place was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet retreat : )”
Reviews.Author: travelcatnyc
Reviews.Content: It has taking me a while to write this review, but I have finally done it!!!i My family and I went to the Rincon Beach Resort last August 2007. I am originally from Puerto Rico and visit every year. We stay at a different hotel every time we visit. We are not extremely picky, but we like good service and a nice place. Like previous reviewers wrote, it is not so much of a resort as it is a nice hotel. However, they need to update certain areas. As far as the grounds, they were really nice and obviously well kept. Our room was nice. Please keep in mind when you visit, that the rooms do not have carpeting and the floor can get very cold when the AC is onl......which is on pretty much all the time since is very hot there. We hated the pool, although a nice pool, it was obvious that it needed a heavy cleaning. There were black spots of some kind of mold inside of it. After reading some of the most updated reviews here, I realized they must have cleaned it. I am glad they did because they have a beautiful setting. The beach is great and private. When we stayed at the hotel, there were hardly any people present and it felt like we had the pool to ourselves. I guess that is because August is not a very popular month to travel to a hot island. There were times when we were the only ones by the pool or beach. It was a very relaxing stay. If you are looking for excitement.....this is not the place for you!!! You will definetely need a car because there are really not many close places to eat at.....town is quite a few miles away. It is a very sleepy and quiet town. Staff was very nice, however, not overly friendly. The hotel only has one restaurant, where breakfast, lunch, and dinner is served. Overall, we liked our stay and will recommend this place to someone looking for a quiet relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “VERY PLEASED WITH OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: Tango73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and was very suprised with the hotel. We had a delux ocean view with a king bed and the room was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful with our every need. I will say you must have a rental car if you want to take advantage of the surrounding activities due to the resorts location, but it was exactly what my new bride and I wanted. I would recommend this place to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, had to work to get the room / features we wanted”
Reviews.Author: keeandlee
Reviews.Content: After enduring a seemingly endless winter in New York and Connecticut, my friend and I booked a trip to Rincon Beach Hotel on the the hotel's Sterling Hotels website. We reserved a "double queen" ocean view room online for a 5-day stay. When we arrived to check in, they had put us in a tiny single-queen bedroom with a tiny balcony, with "partial ocean view". We immediately asked for at least a king bed, instead of a single queen. They put us into a very small king room that had a badly chipped and rusted bathtub (it turns out many of the rooms in the hotel have damaged / rusted bathtubs) and a vanity sink drain that drained very slowly. The front desk clerks (there were two on duty) were very busy talking amongst themselves, and sometimes seemed oblivious to the presence of customers waiting at the front desk. We had been traveling for most of a day to get there, and there was no help from the hotel for us to get our bags to our 4th floor room. They pointed us to a baggage cart (self service?) so we took our own bags to the room. I thought the lack of a porter / bellhop was out of place in a hotel that charges over $230.00 per night. At breakfast the first morning, which we had in the hotel's restaurant outdoor patio (nicer place to eat, but the crows will absolute bandits and we had to dodge bird "droppings"). The breakfast buffet, which cost almost $15.00 per person (before the hotel's obligatory 15% automatic tip added to the bill, but which also does not go to the servers, but rather to the restaurant) was pricey. It was nice, and they had good homemade pastries (some days, depending on which chef was working). The pool was beautiful. However, we were reluctant to swim in its water because the water appeared murky.. perhaps not so clean. There were dozens of people in the pool, including many small children, and adult patrons of the swim-up bar. The beach was beautiful, and the deck chairs were plentiful, as were the complimentary beach towels. The sun and temperatures were great for relaxing and we enjoyed many nice walks on the huge sandy beach. We ended up moving to a newer room the second day we were there, to the double-queen we were promised when we first made our reservation. We had a rental car, so we drove to the Puntas section of Rincon and had several great meals at the local restaurants on the surfing beach side of Rincon. Two great little restaurants were the tapas bar at Casa Islena, and The Rum Shack and Smiling Joes restaurants at The Lazy Parrot Inn on highway 413. We would rate those restaurants right up there with any we've eaten at in our many travels. Some of the winding roads and beautiful views of the ocean made for exciting sight seeing opportunities. Rincon is a great place to go for a slower pace of life than the metro area of San Juan. Be ready for very narrow serpentine steep roads which the locals hog and always seem to blare their high beams. Have fun and bring your sunscreen...get out early as the rains and clouds came around 2ish and somedays never clear until the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelkids
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice, relaxing away from it all stay. This is your place. Spent 2 nights, we are a family of 5 (kids 12,9,6) We had a great time. Rooms were clean. Pool and beach were perfect. Beautiful sunsets. Very close to local restaurants about 5 min. drive. We visited Villa Cofresi for dinner and it was like mad house. We were so glad we chose Rincon Beach resort instead. Staff was friendly. If you are looking for entertainment and a more lively atmosphere this is not it. Would highly recommend Rincon Beach Resort and will definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families!”
Reviews.Author: IainMcc
Reviews.Content: A great resort for a relaxing, 'away from it all' vacation. My wife, 2 year old son and I loved the pool, the small children's park and the beach. All right there in this perfectly sized resort. 5 star excellence it is not but a comfortable 3 or 4 star standard of room and facilities. Loved the coffee station that was present for 1 day, then it disappeared! Restaurant adequate for breakfast buffet. Other meals were enjoyed in nearby Rincon. We like to explore a little so it was perfect. Staff all very friendly, and responsive to feedback and suggestion. Car rental recommended, Aguadilla Airport only 30 minutes away. Loved it, and our expectations are high but not unrealistically so.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Rincon Beach Resort. We found the setting to be great - somewhat isolated but still close to the town, restaurants, etc. There was actually a really fun pool hall across the street we had a blast at! The pool area and beach were great, and we really liked the open-air lobby. The one note I would make it to be careful in selecting your room type. We chose a queen sofa bed room which actually ended up only having a queen sofa bed - in other words, no real bed. The room was still really nice with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, bathroom, just no bedroom. Apparently the adjoining room is the bedroom which you can rent in addition (for example, it would be great for a family) we just didn't know this ahead of time. It ended up not being a big deal though b/c the pull-out couch was pretty comfy. Plus, with such a nicely decorated room and ocean views from our windows we couldn't be too upset! Aside from that we ate breakfast at the restaurant there and found the food to be really good and very reasonably priced. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again!!”
Reviews.Author: HPHNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I perused around the website in anticipation of our 5 night vacation last week. The website is completely deceiving. The rooms look NOTHING like they portay them to look. They all like a roadside Motel 6, equipped with the moldy smell, pea size shower head, old OLD looking hotel furniture, a large trash dump DIRECTLY outside the hotel room we were supposed to stay in, and neglectful customer service. When we arrived at 3 am (due to the 11:46 pm arrival on the Continental flight from Newark) the front desk guy didj't even bother to motion to help me (6 months pregnant) with the bags I was carrying, while my husband parked. I thought I wold cry. I slept for 4 hours, woke up, checked out, got the refund for the remaining days, and ran to the amazing HORNED DORSET PRIMAVERA. You pay for the upgrade, but for a one time vacation, it is worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: KDAA
Reviews.Content: First, let me qualify my review by saying that due to flight issues, our stay here was cut to one night. I have mixed feelings on this facility. There were some things I liked a lot, and others I wasn't happy about. Pros: - Very nice beach: It has a very pretty and secluded location - The pool and hot tub area was very nice - Although I wasn't there with kids, it was a family-friendly location (this might not be a pro for some people) - Very nice room - Friendly, helpful staff Cons: - Very loud. We had a first floor room near the elevator, and you could hear everything. The tile floors in the outside hall area also contribute to the noise. It also looked out directly on the kids play area. My other main issue, which others have written, is that I have a little problem with the "resort" label. The grounds are very nice, but compact. There is one small restaurant and one small lobby bar. There appeared to be some water activities, but I'm not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Puerto Rico but had a brush with death in Rincon!!”
Reviews.Author: essebee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our honeymoon by taking a 7 day cruise in the Caribbean followed by spending a week in Puerto Rico. We explored several areas in Puerto Rico and quickly discovered our favorite spots. We looked forward to spending time at The Rincon Beach Resort for one of our night's stay. When we arrived at the resort it looked charming and inviting. The staff greeted us warmly and we felt like things were off to a good start. After checking in we went to our room. It had a partial ocean view and a view of the pool. Not bad so far. After pulling back the covers on the bed, I was horrified to see hundreds of crawling small insects. I am not sure what kind of insect(s) they were. I mentioned it to my husband and he didn't make a fuss and neither of us told the hotel staff. Probably should have. We tried to go forward and both of us were ready to relax after being in a hot car most of the day. We immediately changed and hit the beach!! We swam in the ocean then took a 2 hour stroll on the beach. There were several beautiful flowering plants along the rocky cliffs of the beach and several bees buzzing on the flowers. We noticed that there were also several bees on the sand too. My husband stepped onto a bee and got stung but was alright. I didn't get stung by any bees. But later something crazy happened!! After taking a stroll on the beach the sun was starting to set and we decided to get into the hotel hot tub. It felt wonderful. Afterwards we headed up to our room, showered and prepared for dinner at the hotel restaurant. While I was getting ready and dressed, I felt nauseous and dizzy and was contemplating telling my husband I couldn't make it to dinner. But I didn't want to spoil the beautiful evening so I kept getting ready. We both went to dinner and 10 minutes after we sat down I blacked out for about 15 seconds then I couldn't br eathe. I didn't even have a chance to eat anything yet. The food looked like it would have been delicious!! I told my husband and the waiter that something was wrong with me. My condition got worse and an ambulance was called. A gentleman of the wait staff comforted me while my husband ran to our room to try and find one of my benadryl capsules. The ambulance took forever and my heart was pounding and my body had tremors all over. I felt like I was dying. My husband and the gentleman decided to rush me to the hospital because the ambulance was nowhere in sight. We arrived at the emergency entrance and I fainted into my husbands arms. I was admitted to the emergency room and the doctor said I almost died. They didn't know what caused the episode but pumped me full of liquid benedryl, etc. Our entire stay in Puerto Rico was great until we got to Rincon. What caused this left us both baffled. Could it have been something at the hotel? The hot tub? Ocean? Beach? I am very hesitant to go back to that particular locale but I still enjoy Puerto Rico. Overall we had a nice time. Thank God I didn't die on our honeymoon. Just be careful and pack that epipen or benadryl. Wear shoes if at all possible on the beaches as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but we're sure we could find a better place for the same cost”
Reviews.Author: DreaminWyoming
Reviews.Content: Overall, the aesthetic s of the resort was very nice. Beautiful part of Puerto Rico. The rooms could've been cleaner (especially the bathroom) and the music went much too late on Saturday night. The mornings were very noisy too - lots of banging and we could hear someone on the treadmill each morning - which was extremely annoying. The drinks at the bar were outrageously high priced, so we headed north into Rincon where we could purchase our own beer and wine - very cheaply! Having a car is a must and we never stayed on the resort beach except for the first day because we found a much more beautiful spot about a 45 minute drive to the south. Mayaguez has got a good mall if you feel like shopping. Next time - we would more than likely look for a resort further south.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: k99r
Reviews.Content: This resort is well past its prime. Other than food and drink it offers virtually nothing in the way of entertainment. The staff is friendly and helpful but there just isn't anything to do there other than beach and pool. The room's furniture was in need of repair and the bathtub glazing was chipping off. Normally this doesn't bother me but I paid premium money for a second rate facility.

Reviews.Title: “I started missing it before we left.....”
Reviews.Author: Cutternsanchez
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for a group of 16 of my friends as our western Puerto Rico destination and jumping off point. I (we?) couldn't have been happier!! I would have given this hotel my highest rating but for a couple of very minor things. What are those minor things? 1. Coffee in the a.m.-- There are no coffee makers in the rooms and no coffee service in the courtyard or lobby. You must ask a waiter in the restaurant for a cup, and it's a small one at that. 2. If you're like me and love to have breakfast on the beach in the open air, you ain't gonna get it. Breakfast is only served indoors in the courtyard restaurant. (OK, so they have a small patio ajoining the restaurant, but I'm partial to crashing waves with my croissants). 3. Ice machines are not located on every floor. OK, condemn me for being an American, but I gots to have my ice....lots of it..... and close by. That's all I can think of for the "bad things" After organizing trips with my friends over the last 10 years, I can't think of a more wonderful and stress free hotel experience. Witness this testimony. I've never written one of these reviews before!!! On the first night of our arrival, no restaurant in town could handle us with such short notice so we decided to do dinner in the hotel restaurant ("Brasas" I think it's called). Since there were so many of us with such different tastes, we ordered just about everything on the menu. It was all good to excellent. I think the skirt steak and the scallops with "brown sauce" were the best. The staff was very friendly and helpful: especially Borja at the front desk, Dennis at the pool bar, and "Eddie" aka Jessica at the lobby bar. If you decide to stay there, tell "Eddie" that "Brittany" says "HI!!" She loves to be called Eddie. The pool was kept immaculately clean....even despite the weekend traffic....and the jacuzzi was the perfect temp. The grounds were kept very clean. I loved the beds. Etc. Etc. Bottom line is that I stayed there 8 nights and wished I'd stayed longer. On one day I took a tour around to the 3 other hotels that I'd considered other than the Rincon Beach Resort to check them out. We made the right choice!!!!! All I can say to the R. Beach Resort is "Fix the coffee situation, and I'd give you a +10 and +5-stars"

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: sgonzalez1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married here on Jan 19, 2008. It was beautiful. I am from Arecibo, so naturally I wanted to be married in Puerto Rico. My favorite part of PR is this side of the island because it's not commercialized. I chose Rincon Beach Resort because it was quaint, kind of secluded, and beautiful. 150 people attended my wedding and we had the best time. The resort catered the whole thing and everyone said that the food was the best "wedding" food they had ever had. By the way- the wedding coordinator for the hotel is incredible. If I could have hired her as my wedding planner I would have. The service was excellent. I'm not sure why anyone would say otherwise. Everyone was sooo pleasant and very professional. The first night we were there, there was problem with one of my guests' room and they handled it immediately. I guess my only complaint is that I feel everything there is overpriced. Outside of that I loved it and I didn't have any problems what so ever. I do recommend that you stay in the "Junior Suite" there. I can't tell you how beautiful the view is from that room and the room itself is very nice. Anyone that says this resort isn't worth it is crazy!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: williamtmoore
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time at the Rincon Beach Resort. The hotel was a little hard to find traveling at night, but after we missed our turn we just turned around and eventually found it. The hotel is actually located in a town called Anasco, which is on the town line border with Rincon. The hotel has a security guard on duty at all times and we always felt very safe our entire time at the hotel. The staff is very friendly and they all speak English well. The hotel room was nice and big with 2 queen beds, cable TV and a little desk. The air conditioning really gets the room cool in a hurry. You can also purchase movies on the TV. The hotel restaurant is great for breakfast. The buffet is excellent. The service is also very good and the prices are just right. For lunch the poolside snack bar has burgers and hot dogs and chicken fingers and stuff. For dinner I would suggest you take a quick drive to Rincon and eat anywhere along the road. Just take a left out of the hotel gate and there are many places on the left side of the road that we stopped at that wee great. If you are craving Mc Donaldâ€™s or Burger King or Subway just keep heading down the road through Rincon and you will find them. If you are looking for a market there is a small one that has al the basics like milk, bread, diapers and such down the road to the right. There is also a dollar store theyâ€™re as well. If you want to go shopping or want to gamble, take a right out of the hotel gate and head towards Mayaguez. There is a great casino/hotel on the left about 5 miles down the road. There is also a bunch of shopping centers on the right. Rincon Beach Resort has an awesome pool and a fantastic beach area with lots of space and coconut trees. Although no beaches in Puerto Rico are private beaches because of laws saying so, this one is private because it is surrounded by hills and mountains on both sides making it impossible for locals to travel through. I love the fact that the hotel as an open courtyard with lots of couches and chairs that you can sit and relax and order a drink and browse the Internet with their free wireless wifi. The only complaint I would have is that there is no room service. The only other hotel in the Rincon area that is better then this one is the Horned Dorset Primavera. But this hotel is very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was waiting for.”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at reception the clerk was unfriendly. She does not informed us of anything I have to ask the questions. The room number given does not exist. I have to go down in the elevator to find someone to help me find the room. Actually the maintenace staff was more friendly and told me that because the room number was missing someone put another number on that room.The room was little but okay. The worst thing was the noisy ceiling I suppossed there were eleven kids or something like that because of the noise during the night and day. So I decided to sleep in the lounge chairs on the beach. That was more quietly. the restaurant is excellent. That was the best.

Reviews.Title: “paradise found”
Reviews.Author: GeorigaCasinoman
Reviews.Content: After driving across Puerto Rico in the middle of the night, we came across a place that the hotel manager told us about as if it had been a myth. It was like finding the garden of eden snuggled into a distant cove. Top 10 reasons why you should stay at the Rincon Beach Resort. 1. Best Service and food in PUERTO RICO. 2. Only three star resort that is really a five star. 3. Best mojitos in Puerto Rico. Thanks to Eddie. 4. You can beach fish right out your room door. 5. Family affordable with happy meal included. 6. Locals actually want you to be there. 7. At Rincon Beach Club they put the "h" in hospitality. 8. Free use of all water sports included in your price. 9. Not so developed that you feel like you're in a tourist trap. 10. Will give you discounts with longer stays. - David and Cassandra Justice

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with private beach”
Reviews.Author: mcmug2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 week while traveling on business in PR. Awesome establishment and great location. Quiet, family friendly place. Great selection at the buffet breakfast in the restaurant (cost: $15 including tax/tips). Dinner menu was pretty good too. Only downside is that I'm in the office and not in the hotel during the day (8am to 6pm), so I hardly get to see what the beach is like in the afternoon. I did manage to go to the beach on the Saturday morning and there was hardly anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated Paradise- A Must!”
Reviews.Author: Yess22
Reviews.Content: I had read many great reviews on here, which helped me to narrow down where to stay that I promised myself I would return the favor. I had made no prior reservations, wanted to do a spontaneous check in for my birthday. We drove up to the hotel from Ponce Airport and arrived around 9am. We asked for availability and price for that night on June 22. If they didnâ€™t have any rooms available, we were going to spend the night with family. Not only did they have an Ocean view King size room available @ a great rate of $199 (Room 404), they also were able to have the room ready for us by 9:30 am. Talk about early check-in! The place was isolated. Perfect for what we wanted- isolation. It's like we had the hotel all to ourselves. Not until that evening and the following day did, the groups of people start arriving. I think many of the natives go there for weekend getaways. If the natives are paying to go there, then it must be good. The PiÃ±a Colada's @ the swim up bar were the best I've ever had. They have just the right amount of rum. Exactly what a Colada is suppose to taste like. The room was very clean, a little on the small side, but perfect for a couple. They were doing some renovating, which did disturb our midday nap around late afternoon, but I guess since it was the low season and they don't want to close down to complete all renovations, this was the best time to do it. The front desk was great. Omar gave us great suggestions on where to dine outside of their resort. They did not force us to stay and use their restaurant, which I thought was great customer service. Check in and check out was a breeze. Internet service was located in the lobby/bar area only. They had live entertainment (salsa) until about 11pm. Overall, a great experience. The only negative, but nothing that would stop us from going there again is the overpriced rentals for kayaks and other water equipment and the closed gift shop. We are already planning for another trip solely to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuloso!”
Reviews.Author: mayapr99
Reviews.Content: It was a fabulous experience. We visited the Rincon Beach Resort on June 24-25. La Noche de San Juan, a local pagan feast in celebration of St. John Baptist, birthday. At mid-night everyone goes in the water backwards for good luck! The hotel and all the staff were the fantastic. The restaraunt a bit expensive but a excellent quality gourmet, take the 39.00 special it is worth every penny. I do agree with others YOU DO NEED A CAR...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Beautiful Beach!”
Reviews.Author: shida_girlBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay here on June 18-20th with 3 other travelers who were in their 20s. I am a frequent, somewhat discriminating traveler, with this being my 3rd trip to PR. This facility was a nice suprise. First tip: as already stated by other reviews, you definitely need a car! I got a great deal through Hotwire. The hotel was immaculate. We arrived at the hotel at 1 a.m. and the hotel had our rooms waiting for us. The front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. The beach is just lovely! It is very private and the hotel was pretty empty so there was not much activity, which is what we were looking for. Just relaxing on the beach was fabulous. If you are looking for tons of stuff to do, this might not be the place for you. We did not eat at the hotel, in part because the facility did not offer full menus due to the fact that the hotel was so empty. However, we got some good recommendations that we tried that worked out well for us. If you take 115 to 402 to Rte. 2, there is a McDonalds, Walgreens and a place called Bonanza Supermercado. It is a supermarket with a cafeteria counter inside with some of the yummiest food we ate! And it was very reasonably priced. Also, if you exit 115 to your left from the resort, there is a place on your left called Panaderia, which had some yummy breakfast. Further up on your right, there is a restuarant called Rincon Tropical - the most authentic food we are there! And again, reasonably priced. Check-out was a breeze and parking was free. All in all, a good place for hanging out and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but you will need a rental car.”
Reviews.Author: pmac01
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend an I thought that the 30 minute taxi ride from Aguadilla to RBR was fair at 35 dollars. That was until we took a round trip ride into town from the resort for 20 dollars round trip, which is less than 10 minutes away. The front desk attendant informed us that taxis could be difficult and the nothing was in walking distance. After the first day at RBR every couple or family that you met had taken a trip into town to buy their own beer/liquor and snacks. So if you are looking to lounge at a resort for your entire trip with below average food then RBR will be fine. If you plan on experiencing some of the local culture and food then figure on the extra "tourist" tax.
