Reviews.Title: “Nice & relaxing..better have a rental car!”
Reviews.Author: Jakkjk
Reviews.Content: Don't try to find this place the first time at night using the hotel's directions! We needed an escort from the Rincon Police station to finally find it. The room key card problem mentioned so often still exists. The lock was finally fixed the next morning after our arrival. The hotel IS understaffed, including the restaurant. You will be carrying your own bags! Staff was somewhat friendly, if you spoke to them first...and speaking spanish will get you a lot further. Only had breakfast at the resort...slow service! Went out for empanadas and beer each day for lunch (tons of small stands on the road). Had dinner offsite each night....locals we met staying at the resort recommended many great small places nearby. Beach was really great, very calm and clean and uncrowded. Pool was okay, but needed better cleaning each day. Overall very relaxing. The room was not as nice as shown on the websites. Would go back again, but hopefully at a cheaper rate. They have WiFi access in the lobby & poolside, but we were never able to get online for some reason. Rooms were very clean, but very simple. We had a nice balcony overlooking the beach and pool...again very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Getaway”
Reviews.Author: aussieroo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Ricon Beach Resort, it was lovely. The location of the resort is about 10 minutes outside of Rincon, and very secluded- often we were the only ones on the beach. The resort is well maintained, although if you are intereseted in a five star getaway where you need not lift a finger this isn't the place for you- small things like the pool bar closing at a different time each day and kayak rentals being unavailable did not bother us as we spent much of our time exploring the areas around rincon. For activities in the rincon area, I'd recommend Taino Divers who run trips to nearby Desecheo Island and to other local reefs for diving and snorkelling. Next to the dive shop is the Shipwreck Bar and Grill, who make great food at reasonable prices. Overall, we loved Rincon and would recommend it for anyone wanting a quick getway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Duluth-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at about a half-dozen different resorts in the Caribbean (on as many different islands), this is the nicest beach I've ever stayed on - for sheer breadth and lack of development surrounding it. This isn't a white sand beach (tending more toward khaki) but you can walk a far stretch in either direction without encountering any other resorts. Because of that lack of development, despite the fact we were there in high season, we never felt crowded. The water is calm and there is no sea grass or rock to encounter. The resort offers an ample number of lounge chairs - both at the pool area and at the beach. There is never any need to race out first thing in the morning to "claim" a chair and some space. And there is sufficient shade from beach palms to provide cover for even the most sun-adverse. The resort itself had only one observable flaw - it lacks sufficient dining options. There is a sit-down restaurant offering breakfast and dinner, and a pool-area snack bar offering lunch. You would need deep pockets to consistently eat all dinners there as the lowest priced entree on the menu is $19 and there aren't any kid-friendly options on it. The breakfasts are much more reasonable - especially if you order off the menu (the $12 buffet seemed a little pricey). My family gave eight thumbs up to the panini-style breakfast sandwich of egg, ham and cheese. It was served with breakfast potatoes and was more than enough to feed two. The snack bar food was adequate but I recommend you stay away from the burger. It reminded me of the mystery meat from my high school cafeteria. The mahi-mahi wrap was good and the appetizer samplers were fine as well. There are other dining options in the local area but, aside of Taino International Coffee on 115 (open for breakfast, lunch AND dinner) and the Rum Shack on 413 - which are both great options - we didn't spend much time in them. If you visit the Rum Shack (at the Lazy Parrot Inn on 413), be sure to bring your swimsuit - buying a meal there qualifies you to jump in the pool while you wait! The Rincon Beach Resort rooms were nice and the staff were friendly enough, but it is that undeveloped beach that makes the whole visit worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: iwatkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the week of my wedding, we were being married in nearby Rincon. We had almost 20 guestst coming in and felt it would be nice to book everyone in the same hotel. Upon seeing the pictures of the hotel on their website, we felt this place was a better choice than some of the other options available in Rincon. Here is what I didn't like about it: 1. location, sooo far from everything, it took almost 20 minutes to drive into the town where all the restaurants and surfing beaches are 2. a lot of kids. 3. as i mentioned earlier, it is far from restaurants you'd actually want to eat at, and their restaurant and bar closed way too early! 4. gift shop was constantly closed and the kayak rental guy left too early Things I liked: 1. nice hotel, simple and definetely not a 4 star, but a good solid 3 star 2. Free Parking and lots of it 3. friendly staff and were all bilingual 4. nice clean pool and neat pool bar 5. beach was semi-private and basically had it all to ourselves. 6. Delicious breakfast, order the omelet with everything, yum! :) Buffet was ok in a pinch too. Rincon is a neat little town with some great restaurants and great surfing beaches. If I were to go back in the near future I would opt for a rental house rather than this hotel. This hotel is great for families with small children. It worked for what we needed it for but had it been just my husband and I, i would not stay here again. Only because of how far it was to everything we enjoyed most about Rincon.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!!!”
Reviews.Author: mollybhc
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the resort for a little over a week. My husband and I both work at a resort and are usually quite picky, however we have nothing bad to say. Conversations with the res. agent Maritza were very helpful as well as the front desk when we arrived. We needed more space then the room we book and the suite next to us happen to be open. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful in figuring out a solution for us. Although they do not offer a children's program, they did have a staff member entertain the kids at the pool over the weekend, that was very much appreciated. There isn't a lot to do at the resort besides relax and swim, however with the surrounding towns, there's always something to do. I would highly recommend taking a trip to the zoo! A rental car is a must! We would def. return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Rincon Beach Resort and had an incredible time! I was very nervous about staying there after I read all of the awful reviews. I literally don't have one bad thing to say! We arrived around 9:30am and new we wouldn't be able to check into our room until 3 pm, however I went to the front desk and told them we had arrived anyway. They were very nice, let us store our bags and put our room on priority and told us to check back around 2pm. In the meantime we drove into rincon, had lunch and drove farther north on Rt. 413 where all of the surf spots, cute restaurants and Inns were. We came back to the Resort around 1:45 and our room was ready. We stayed in a delux ocean front room, there were absolutely no bugs, everything was clean and very pretty. The beach was great, you can walk in either direction for miles. We had no complaints about the service. I mean, how MUCH service do you need? Everyone at the front desk was so nice and helpfuI. I think the true beauty of staying at this resort is that you have this great secluded location and then you can go exploring into Rincon. Overall a wonderful time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, service so-so”
Reviews.Author: Jasubar
Reviews.Content: Another reviewer here wrote that this hotel is nice, but â€œthe wrong vibe for Rinconâ€�. Before our trip, I didnâ€™t understand this statementâ€¦what could ever be wrong about a nice hotel? Having spent three nights there in early February, I now understand. My husband and I are also inclined to agree with other reviewers that the service level of this hotel is lacking in proportion to what you pay. In fact, he suggested I title this review â€œAll Fluff and No Stuffâ€�. We had no specific problemsâ€¦our room was clean, comfortable and everything functioned the way it should. It was more that the hotel didnâ€™t seem geared toward people who had come to enjoy a Caribbean vacation. For example, it wasnâ€™t possible to get an alcoholic beverage before the poolside restaurant opened at lunchtime and again between the time it closed and the lobby bar opened in the evening. In fact, the first two days we were there, the swim-up bar didnâ€™t open at all because all the other guests besides us were there for a sales meeting and spent their days in conference rooms instead of at the pool. Finally, as the weekend approached, more vacationers arrived and we started to feel more of a relaxed vibe like the Caribbean to which weâ€™re accustomed. Then, we did start to really enjoy this hotel, especially its beautiful pool and drop-dead gorgeous sunsets. So would I stay here again? The pool itself was really nice, the beachfront was the nicest of any I saw in Rincon and our room itself was nice. But if I returned to Rincon Beach Resort, to be honest it would be wth lowered expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Needs service help!”
Reviews.Author: patamitchell
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, there was no bellstaff, and they told us, as well as many others, that we had to wait for our rooms. We waited until 3:45. We had no where to go, as Rincon has little to see and do. Though our 2-suite was spacious, and the kitchen was very nice, there were bugs crawling on the counter and no pot holders or kitchen towels. They did have flatware and pots/pans, and dishes, though. While on the small beach, they didn't have waitstaff to offer food and drinks; the nice bar tender had to do it all. They also closed the pool bar at 4:00 and the outdoor cafe at 2:00; therefore, you could not eat or drink again until 5:00 when the lobby bar opened with the almost rude bartender. They had told us that you could get snorkeling trips from the hotel and that was not true. They need a activities on the premeise besides sitting and playing the large chess game they have. The SMALL putting green needed repair, as did many of the umbrellas by the pool. As we left, and we were carring our own luggage (my husband had fallen and had a knee brace on), an employee squeezed by us without offering to help. I gues we were able to save money on tipping! I would not return because they didn't seem to care if we, or othere, were there or not. Very unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Short on delivery”
Reviews.Author: PuravidaCT
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star property masquerading as a 5 star. My wife and I picked Puerto Rico to celebrate a special birthday and our anniversary. We both travel extensively for work and leisure. While in Puerto Rico we stayed at 3 locations over 10 days and found all of them to be very over-priced for what you get. The Rincon was no exception. Upon check-in we were assigned to a room that I wouldn't pay Motel 6 prices let alone what they charge. I complained to the front desk and after discussions with management we were upgraded to a very nice suite. However, this was the end of good customer service. The staff is extremely nice, but accomplish nothing! Our shower would not drain the entire stay and each time I mentioned it to the front desk they would smile and assure me that someone would fix it. It was never fixed. The cable TV was out for 3 days, not a great loss, but no offer was made to compensate for this. A management meeting was scheduled one evening and many guests attended with lists of problems. Unfortunately, nobody from management showed up. The wedding party was the topper. A lagre, raucous group from NY took over the pool area and bar during our entire stay. The staff should have controled them better and given consideration to all the other guests. I would hesitate to book a room at this resort unless you don't have a problem paying alot, but getting little in return.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star prices, three-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJTdt
Reviews.Content: If the Rincon Beach Resort charged three-star rates, I would have no complaints. The beach and location are great, the pool is nice, and the staff is generally helpful. The problem is the resort is charging five-star rates and simply not delivering. Here's an abbreviated list of issues we had: card keys repeatedly not working, ants in the room, aspects of "deals" we took not being fulfilled, cable TV being out for several days, very loud and large wedding parties overtaking the beach area, overpriced restaurant on site, underwhelming "gym." The Ritz it ain't. To be clear, the resort was family-friendly, is in a great location, and we generally had fun...but when you charge five-star rates, you'd better deliver a five-star experience. It's clear the management doesn't have a clue.

Reviews.Title: “Zero Customer Service, Get a Clue”
Reviews.Author: surfndeez
Reviews.Content: First off, I'd like to say that I am not a picky traveler. Give me a comfortable place to sleep that's free of lots of noise and bugs, and I'm fine. However, traveling with my wife and toddler changes things a bit...you need a hotel that can support your family's needs. The first night we arrived in ANASCO, not RINCON like the website and name of the resort imply, we were exhausted and just wanted to crash. Much to our dismay, the card for our room (the key) did not work. This should been a sign to leave immediately. After a few attempts and a new card, we were able to enter the room. The next day, we had to exchange cards about 5 times, the next day another 5 times and we started to complain, the next day we were so infuriated I actually had to raise my voice with the front desk in order for them to help out with the situation. To boot, the bathtub in our room would not fill up with water to give our daughter a bath. Rather than just change the room and throw us something for our troubles after the first 3 days of complaining, they played games with us "we'll have our repair man see to it, etc". Finally, I told the front desk that we NEED another room and that we need to be compensated for our headache. Our room was changed, but not ONCE did ANYONE offer to help us move all of our stuff (we had to move to a totally new building, mind you). After lugging all of our stuff to the new room, the DOOR STILL DID NOT OPEN. After arguing with the front desk and the repair guy again, we were allowed access to the adjoining suite next to our room. The lock on the suite door worked for the reminder of the stay and everything was fine. We were comped a free night, and we had use of the suite for th remainder of the trip. All of these problems could have been avoided and the hotel wouldn't have had to comp me anything if: the front desk gave us another room right from the start and did not play games with us. Another thing that could have helped would have been some common courtesy (ie help us move all our crap while moving to another room). All I have to say is GET A CLUE RINCON BEACH RESORT, you have a lot to learn about customer service. You'll never see us again, and we will spread the word.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: missguinness
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early May, and on the weekdays it was nearly empty. As you'll see in my photos, there were weekdays when we had the beach, pool, and hot tub all to ourselves. When going out to dinner, the local restaurants were equally quiet, so it seems that May is a great time to visit Rincon if you want to get away from other tourists. On the weekend, there were many more guests, but that was good too because they staffed the pool bar, brought in live music at dinner, and added outdoor seating at the restaurant. The restaurant on site was pricey but well worth it (just be sure to order off the menu and avoid the buffet). The photos you see at the Rincon Beach website are accurate as far as the pool, the views, and the outside areas of the property. The inside of our guest room was not as cute as their website would lead you to expect, but it was fine. The price was right, and the free parking was appreciated after having stayed in San Juan for a few nights. The beach was clean and safe. Be sure to rent a car as you're not within walking distance of anything. The only thing that disappointed us was that we paid extra for an oceanview room, but our room was tucked back in a corner with only a glimpse of the water. We were ok with that, because we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, but if the view is important to you, be sure to ask which way your balcony faces. Overall, we enjoyed our getaway at RBR much more than our time at a couple of pricier hotels back in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: vagabonds2001
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great pool and is right on a VERY clean stretch of beach. Staff's service was underwelming. Good spot for a family w/ kids who's not to adventurous and is not looking for any variety but wants to stay put. The poor service stems from lukewarm or cold replies from staff about issues wtih food or the TV system going down for an evening. I think teh management just needs to build some confidence in their staff so they are not incapable of making a decision.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but not the right groove for Rincon.”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Rincon Beach Hotel in January of 2006 and we were very happy with our hotel experience. The rooms are very nice, clean and confortable. The restaurants on the property are pretty good and the beach and pool are excellent. All that said, this hotel seems too fancy and stiff for the town of Rincon. Rincon has more of a "beach bum" vibe than a large resort feeling. This, or course, has nothing to do with the hotel itself but instead relates to our experience of this area of Puerto Rico. If you want a "standard semi-luxury resort" experience then the Rincon Beach Hotel will be perfect. If you want a more authentic "Rincon vibe" then we'd recommend staying somewhere smaller, quainter and closer to town. All in all, the hotel was a very good experience but Rincon is groovier than this.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: BSJS
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel. If you like a simple vacation, ie laying around on the beach all day, this is a good place to do it. Despite being near a lot of surfing areas, the water is quite calm at this beach. We had a little problem when we first arrived. We had reserved an ocean view room, but they were overbooked and we were given a garden view. This was very annoying as we arrived very late at night. However, the next day they showed us two ocean view rooms, and gave us our choice. At the end of our stay, the hotel completely removed the charges from the first night. The grounds are well kept, and the rooms are simple, but in good condition and clean. The only meals we had at the hotel were breakfast which was very good. Most of the restaurants around town are very simple and not much to talk about. Our favorite place was the restaurant at the Lazy Parrot Inn -- very good!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Devoted_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights with my husband on this hotel over this Labor Day weekend. We got a regular (superior) room, and we found it quite spacious and clean. The hotel itself is quite pretty and the views are incredible!! The pool overlooking the ocean was sooo nice. The staff was attentive and the restaurant good (although they ran out of the special of the day, which I wanted, but what I got was good). The only drawbacks for us were that there was no room service, the gift shop had few articles and closed early, and that there were no snack vending machines (only sodas). Other than that we had a great time; including the fact that we rented a kayak at the hotel and had a lot of fun just going around on it on the beach. It is a nice hotel to relax and would return again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rincon Beach Resort Lovely”
Reviews.Author: DJCB
Reviews.Content: The Rincon Beach Resort was everything I expected it to be. I was a little worried based on some of the reviews I read on this site. However, I am happy to report that I am more on the side of the positive reviews than the negative ones. The place looks just like the picture you see on their website. Our room the junior bedroom suite was larger than expected and looked just like the picture. Our balcony over looked the pool and beach, which provided us with an awesome view to wake up too and a wonderful way to watch the sunset. I am happy to report that my whole family enjoyed the resort. I found the place to be very clean â€“ room, pool, Jacuzzi and lounge area. The hotel employees were extremely accommodating. The only drawback was the condition of the tennis courts and their inability to find the key to allow us into the courts. Other than that the place was beautiful. Also they have wifi for those who which to take their laptops with them on vacation however you can only access the Internet in their lobby/ bar area. Overall I give this resort a good rating and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable and kid friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: PR_Resident_88
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 kids (14 and 11) and I just came back last week from RINCON BEACH RESORT. Where we stayed for the fourth of July long weekend. This is our second time at the resort and have enjoyed both times. We enjoy the resort as there facility is nicely decorated and you can count on clean rooms, clean sheets, the pool and hot tub are cleaned every morning. Service was also good. There is a poolside bar (although drinks are pricey, as in alot of the resorts) there was always a bartender at the poolside bar unlike other reviewers mentioned and there were always fresh towels. Although the only restaurant is also a bit pricey, (around $14.00 p/p for breakfast, how much can you eat that early??) there are many restaurants on the same road as the resort that you may enjoy. There are various hotels and other resorts very close by that you may go to and enjoy there restaurants. Also you have all the fast food restaurants available at a 15 min drive. There were activities for the kids water games for my 11 year old, volleyball games for my 14 year old, also kayaking and boat games for all of us. All free since it was a holiday weekend I assume, prices are usually around $20.00 p/hr for kayaking and pedaled boots. Yes there were alot of children in the pool but normal in any family setting (unless you go to a no childrens allowed resort like horned dorset) there will be children. Overall I highly recommend this resort for beach lovers as the beach is very close to the pool area and you may enjoy a very caribbean setting.Pool chairs are readily available eventhough the resort was full that weekend. Also in rincon you can enjoy the best sunsets of the Island. Hope you find this helpfull !! Enjoy...........

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: lmkiernan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort over Easter vacation this year. I was scared away by some of the reviews I read before our trip so I shortened our stay there and booked another hotel down the beach (which I HATED and we only stayed there for 1 night before we found another hotel to stay at) BIG MISTAKE we should have just stayed here. We went as a family of 4 (4 year old and a 2 year old) so we weren't expecting a 5 star hotel or 5 star service. We shopped around for prices online and found a good deal on a discount site. Our room was nice, a typical hotel room 2 queen beds, cable tv, balcony, bathroom. Our room was cleaned every day, we had fresh towels if we didn't hang them up. There is a sign in the bathroom that says they conserve water so if you hang your towels up they will assume you don't want fresh ones, so be sure to put your towels in a pile in the bathroom if you would like new ones every day. As far as food goes, we ate breakfast there on our first morning, it was a decent meal, and we ordered food for the two of us after the kids went to bed one other night. The only draw back to that is there is no room service and we had to walk down to the resturant to order, then they call your room when it's ready and you walk back. The food was good, a little on the expensive side. We were there to visit family so we at out or at our family's house most of the time. The playground was the best attraction for my 2 children. They could have spent all day there. The pool was nice, it was clean the 3 days we stayed so we have no complaints there and the pool bar was open and staffed but we were there on a weekend so I'm not sure about a weekday. They give you towel cards that you have to redeem at the gift shop for beach towels. You bring the towel back there and receive new ones when ever you want. The "gift shop" isn't much at all. Just a few hats, t-shirts (kids sizes only) and some beach toys. Because we stayed over the Easter holiday there was activities planned for the children. They had an easter egg hunt on the playground which they seperated into age groups, and the "easter bunny" left a surprise outside our door in the morning. Overall we truly enjoyed our stay at the Rincon Beach Resort and will stay there again when we visit our family.

Reviews.Title: “yuck!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: well, I am a travel agent.... and apparently that didn't make a difference. 1st-my room had bugs in the shower..... i said something to them at the front desk, and they did nothing... so i took care of it myself- bought bug stuff from the grocery store. 2nd- the food was terrible - i threw up from eating there the first time... and never ate there again- not to mention the bugs in the the container holding the sugar. 3rd- no weather guards under my balcony door or room door... so the bugs were flying in.. and i had to use towels (which they do not give u enough of) to put underneath to keep them out. 4th- on Friday (our last day) we got up and headed for the pool.... came back to the room at 330p and the room was still not clean. 5th- the pool was dirty... gross.... Some of the staff was very nice - but not very helpful at all. I will never return to this "resort" again. Or recommend it to any of my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Rincon Beach Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The suite was far less than we expected from the web site or the price. Worn, somewhat dirty, no water pressure in one shower, torn tiles in the other bath. The area is not a tourist area, there is no shopping and the snorkeling and other water activities outsike the resort were nonexistent. We enjoyed the beach for one night and headed back to San Juan for the rest of our visit. Decent hotel if you only want to lay on the beach. Saturday night was occupied by a loud wedding. No accommodations made for paying guests. On site restaurant was okay. Amazing lack of fruit and vegetables for a Caribbean island. I think this is a resort for locals, not much to offer for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Rincon & Not Full Service Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In early February, my friends and I stayed at this "resort" for 3 nights. The structure itself is smartly designed and comfortable but there are not the amenities one would associate with a resort. The gift shop was never open, the soda machines did not work and the staff seemed lazy and unaccommodating. We enjoyed our time at the beach and swimming in the pool but were disappointed by the price of pool side drinks (and slim selection of options) and the lack of music. This business is potentially disappointing to what savvy travelers expect in a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a management makeover”
Reviews.Author: jpncpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in a gardenview room which was booked at their cheapest online rate. The room was cleaned nicely everyday. The room was relatively small for a hotel of this size and appearance but acceptable. The main problem at this resort is the lack of management attention to major resort features. The pool and whirlpool/jacuzzi were fine for the first three days, but appeared not to be cleaned for our final four days. It had alot of sand and dead bugs, but most of all was cloudy and obviously unsanitized. We had to take my wife to see a doctor who determined that she had an infection probably from the water quality in jacuzzi/whirlpool which required antibiotic treatment. During the week, staff coverage at the swim up bar was non-existent or only upon request. One day we were told that the person responsible for signing out/renting the small boats was not in and no one else could help us. In addition and contrary to prior reviews here, the ability to upgrade seems to have ended. The hotel was not full during the week and staff emphatically said they did not have any other rooms for us because they were booked (where were the people), maybe because we booked their lowest internet rate? The staff never informed us of a wedding reception on a Saturday evening until the night before. Not an entirely big deal, but would have been a nice touch to offer some courtesy to guests rather than directing them to stay away from the open courtyard and telling us what hotel amenities would not be available for us. The gated entrance feature is nice, but there is no guard during daylight hours and anyone can drive in with the open gate....seems very apparent that alot of people do during the weekend and use the facilities for free. The beach is nice, but the actual body of water is the Anasco Bay, which is calmer than the open ocean in Rincon, but it suffers from a high degree of algae (was told by a local) and also from some residual pollution from the nearby port of Mayaguez. The water is not dirty, but if you are looking for blue or turquoise water, this is not it. Would recommend spending more to stay at one of the finer places in San Juan or paying less and staying at a Parador, a local group of Puerto Rican style hotels throughout the island, such as near Boqueron and using some of the true south facing Caribbean beaches. Prices in the hotel were of a five star resort, so we ate at some nice local places within 10 minute drive of the hotel, which enhanced the experience and were 1/5 to 1/2 the prices inside the hotel. Management seemed shocked at my periodic complaints and offered no dispute resolution other than a comment card at trip's end.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just came back from staying at the Ricon Beach Resort for six days. We had a junior suite which was beautiful. The room was cleaned everyday. We ate all our breakfests and three dinners at the hotel. The food was very good, service was slow and a little pricey. The pool beach bar was, also, very good. The mixed drinds I found to be expensive. The staff were very friendly, pleasant and helpful. The pool area was clean, but I had to pick up bottles and cups left on the beach almost every day. They need to rack the beach area. If you are looking for a quite resort and just want to relax, this is it. I would go back again. If you fly into Puerto Rico, fly into one of close airports to the hotel. We flew into San Juan Airport and it was a three hour drive to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “The "Resort" Put Into Perspective”
Reviews.Author: LawGuy
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at the Rincon Beach Resort. Though I have stayed at nicer places, it minimally met my expectations. I think it would for other folks too if you consider some of the following: 1) This place is not for everybody. If you're young and want to be closer to night life, consider staying in Rincon proper. The resort, as their posted address indicates, is in Anasco (really not very far from the action (10-20 minute drive from most of the Rincon attractions and services)). If you have a family (particularly teenagers) there is not a lot to do for them (kayak rentals - $20/hour, pool, a very warm but not hot tub, 2 computers with internet (and viruses), a ping pong table, beautiful beach). While these amenities may be enough for adults looking to do little or nothing for a few days, they hardly hold the attention of teenagers for very long. If you need to rely on their "full service business center,"...don't. This consists of two computers with viruses, only one computer is attached to an old multi-function printer that I could not get to work (neither could the staff, but I clearly knew more than they did). In addition, cell phone service for Nextel and Verizon seem pretty hit or miss at the resort itself. I was only able to get choppy reception with Verizon, some people we met got lousy reception with Nextel. 2) This place is for mainly couples who are looking to do little on site at the resort but relax at the pool or on the beach (very clean beach, beautiful sunsets). (though you can drive to play tennis or golf, or go diving, or go sight-seeing) 3) Strengths of the Resort. a) The food is mostly above average (to give a frame of reference: we styed at a Sheraton in Kauai that served pretty much cafeteria (average to below average) food). Some dishes are excellent (steak tips appetizer available at the lobby bar). But squeaky door at Las Brassas Restaurant works your nerves quickly. b) Very good assortment of quality wine is offered (at hotel prices). Their house wine is a good quality Mondavi (merlot, cab, or chard). While highly slurpable, this is the only wine offered "by the glass." c) Beautiful Location, but landscaping could use some more attention and if you're on the first floor, sprinklers will soak your entire patio starting around 11 PM. d) Mixed drinks seem to be pretty good even at the pool bar (not watered down..interesting tropical mixes). e) Food prices seemed pretty reasonable compared to other hotels I have stayed at. 4) Weaknesses of the Resort. a) Service is a mixed bag of tricks. I found some of the managers to be very accommodating and would go out of their way to help. Some seemed to have "it's not my job" attitude. Some of the service staff (particularly a couple of the bartenders) are easy to offend and have some attitude. In general, some of the service staff seem to take offense at being treated as servants and feel entitled to be spoken to as equals. If you are able to take the "you catch more flies with honey" approach, you will probably not have a problem. Nevertheless, the hotel should do more customer service training with these folks. b) The rooms are adequate, bed was decent, but have stayed in greater luxury. ( We stayed in a king bed superior garden view room $165/night at [----------------] website). c) Maintenance is uneven. While the pool is skimmed daily for debris and bugs, the tiles around the top of the water could use a good scrub. Some peeling paint on one building, as others have said some missing tiles, but overall very clean. 5. Value: If you're paying $400/night for this place I would say use it elsewhere where you will get $400/night service and accomodations. We paid $165/night and found that we got what we paid for becuase other resort type places were charging much higher prices (Hyatt Dorado for example). If you can get a room in the range of $150-$230/night, it's probably an all right value. I was looking for a place with good food, decent wine, a decent pool (with bar), an adequate room and a good beach...all for rest and relaxation, very little activity. For the price we paid, we got it. 6. If you decide to stay at Rincon Beach Resort...there are a few good places to eat off-site. A must try place is "Smilin' Joe's" at the Lazy Parrott Inn on Rte 413 in Rincon (not too far from the Lighthouse, but is on a different road). Excellent food and service. Of notable surprise on the menu was some authentic Thai food (chicken satay and shrimp pad thai). Excellent peanut sauce. Many other different kinds of foods to choose from. Very personable wait staff and owners.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel on a great beach”
Reviews.Author: flonj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Rincon. We spent 6 nights at the Rincon Beach Resort. All in all, we were very pleased with this hotel/resort. We do not like big resorts and this one felt relatively small and contained. We were there during President's week, the hotel was full, and yet it never felt overrun or frenzied. First of all, their beach is fantastic. The sea is calm and warm, great for swimming and floating. (If you prefer waves, go to northern Rincon.) The beach right in front of the hotel is kept very clean and has lots of lounge chairs. They even cleaned the ocean floor of rocks in that area. If you want some privacy, you can walk 2 minutes to either side and be alone. The view is great, nice crescent shape, and the sunsets truly spectacular. You can have a drink and watch the sun go down and color the clouds. The courtyard is also very beautiful, and well laid-out. It has pretty landscaping and birds are singing. There is a giant chess game you can play. We never ate at the hotel restaurant, since we prefer simple local foods rather than international cuisine. We did have a sandwich at the beach bistro, which was good. The pool is pretty but full of kids. In a way that's good since that kept the beach area quiet. Again, we were there during a school vacation so this was probably the worst case scenario. Our room was great. We got upgraded from a deluxe to a one bedroom suite (not sure why but perhaps because we booked through a travel agent), so we had a nicely decorated living/dining area and kitchen with all the basic necessities. The bedroom was nicely furnished too. It had a little balcony (the view from our balcony was not that great, just partial ocean, the rest residential buildings on the property). Bathroom was fine. Small hings we didn't like (minor annoyances): There were only 3 hangers in the closet and when we asked for more they didn't have any. Extra pillows were also not available. The printer in the computer room was not working. (However, they let me use the computer in their office to print out our boarding passes.) They charge for tv or even the satellite music channels. Only one station was free access. On the upside, they had a lot of pay per view movies to choose from. And finally, you could hear some traffice on route 115 in our room. It's not a big road (two lanes) but it is the main road into town and so it is busy. In some rooms right on the beach perhaps you wouldn't hear it. The service was friendly, the room and bathroom were very clean every day, but they don't do your dishes. The staff at the front desk was helpful and suggested a good local restaurant. Their snorkeling/diving and other trip operator is no longer in business though so although they have some flyers of other operators, none are affiliated with the hotel (even though they are still listed in the services book in the room). The location is good and easy to get to, about 30 to 45 mins from Aguadilla airport. You will need a car as there is nothing in walking distance of the hotel. Rincon is a short drive away. Overall we were quite happy at Rincon Beach Resort, and it was a very comfortable place to return to at night after exploring during the day.

Reviews.Title: “This is not Rincon”
Reviews.Author: lasami
Reviews.Content: After much research and consideration of where to stay in rincon, puerto rico, I choose the rincon beach resort because I was marveled by its website and gorgeous pictures. I was dissapointed during my stay because of its service. The resort, first of all, is not in RINCON, it is in ANASCO, the next town over. This is important to note for those who seek the watersport adventures, diving, surfing, and nightlife experience that Rincon has to offer because the resort is a good 20-25 minutes away from all the action. There is not much around to do, or eat, because of its seclusion, and you have to definately drive everywhere. The resort is beautiful and very very clean. This is a major plus. The grounds are kept immaculate and it has security. However, it's a shame that their service is not to please the tourist. Breakfast ends at 10am sharp and if you got up late and want a cup of coffee, you have to get in your car and drive. We ordered lunch and ate it by the pool and it came in a basket with no utensils or napkins. The cheeseburger looked like raw meat and you would have been better off a a fast food place. NO KETCHUP in the whole entire resort. We asked for it for the fries and they looked at us like we were from another planet. My father had a splitting headache from laying too much out in the sun and I went to ask front desk to open the giftshop and sell me a tylenol. This was around 5pm. Their response was the girl that runs the shop went home already and she has the keys. No one else, not even the manager had the keys to open the shop and the front desk could not do anything about it. I had to call a friend who lives 25 min away to bring us Tylenols to the complex. Is that incredible or what, this is 2006 people!!! Another major no no for this resort is their food. The only restaurant they have, not cheap may I add, has so so food. And given that everything else is so far away if you are the type of traveler that does not like to go out of the resort wandering, you are stuck with this restaurant and their strick serving schedules. Beautiful POOL AND TIKKI BAR, no one ever there to take drink orders. THIS IS INCREDIBLE. Such a shame. They need to hire a barmaid, or bartender for the pool bar to be there from at least 11am to 4pm. You cannot get any drinks anywhere because the lobby bar does not open til the evening. RINCON BEACH RESORT please pay attention, this is for your own good I am writing this. You have a great place but you do not provide the services that go along with such a complex. Get some live jazz or some activity going on here on the weekends. This place is dead and but for the clean rooms has nothing else to offer. John and Christina Langone, and Sami Perez

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the "Resort", and I use the term loosely, for 3 nights. I made my reservation 1 month ahead of time to make sure I get a Deluxe Oceanview room as seen on their website. When we showed up, they claimed that they didn't have my reservation and the only room they could give us was a suite with a partial oceanview. Only binoculars made this a partial oceanview and the desk clerk calimed that the only rooms with an ideal oceanview were the junior suites which is not accurate according to the website. If so, what exactly is a deluxe oceanview room? We decided to give the only restaurant in the resort a try. It took me 3 tries to get a drink and someone over to take our order. Once we did place our order we sat there for a little over an hour until I decided to get up and inquire about our food, meanwhile other people who came in after us were almost on dessert. Not to be rude , but these people were spanish speaking and I think this had something to do with our lack of service. All in all, waiters and hostesses were rude and unattentive, some desk clerks were helpful, just a disappointing experience. San Juan is a much better choice and if you do take your chances here, don't plan to have fun with water sports or seeing any whales, it's just not going to happen. I've stayed in San Juan before and there is much more to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: kikico
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the resort for a long weekend over Thanksgiving weekend, 2005. Overall, the resort was clean and nice. It was not super-luxurious--the buildings appeared to be fairly cheap construction, and the rooms were basic but the decor was up to date. The pool was very nice, however if you don't like children I would not recommend this resort. I happen to like children, but they were everywhere--jumping in and out of the hot tub, pool, etc. Just not a couples place. My major complaint was that the bathtub in our room was broken (the drain would not retain water), and the staff wasn't the best at responding the situation. They said it would be fixed by morning, but it was not. Again they sent someone up again the next day and we were finally told that it was unfixable. Okay. So we asked if there was another room and were told that the other available room also had a broken bathtub. Also, there were two more slight problems. When we arrived, I pulled down the covers to go to bed and there was a large stain (hopefully a water stain?!) on the sheets--though they did look pressed and clean otherwise. They did send someone to change them immediately. Lastly the hot water in the shower was not too consistant. So, overall it was nice, but a bit inconsistant in the quality. I would probably return, if I didn't feel like forking out the big bucks to go to the Horned Dorsett.

Reviews.Title: “Quite lovely”
Reviews.Author: guilford104
Reviews.Content: The Rincon Beach Resort is located just south of Rincon on the west coast of Puerto Rico. The resort is clean, well-staffed and right on the beach. The room was comfortable with a great view of the water. The pool is clean and well maintained and the hot tub is nice. There are comfortable chaises right on the beach and the sand is soft and the water warm. The restaurant is fine for breakfast but there are more interesting places to eat dinner in town if you want to get into the car. We would go back again, a nice place to take the family. There is a great snorkeling beach up the road in Rincon off route 413, Playa Escalante. Bring your own gear.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I got married, we decided to spend our honeymoon there. We arrived a little bit late, but when we got there we liked the view. Even though we live here, we had a wonderful experience. Our room was very nice and clean, the pool is not awsome but you can enjoy and relax there. The parador is not all luxury but is a good place to have a quiet and pleasant time with your loved ones. We recomend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking, and clean”
Reviews.Author: claudinem
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from Rincon. We stayed at Rincon Beach Resort for 2 days (checked in on Thursday, checked out on Saturday). Overall, we liked the hotel. The grounds were clean and well-kept. The room (we stayed in 554) was also clean, and nice-looking. Same with the pool area and the beach. Both days were quiet by the pool, although there was more people there on Friday than on Thursday. I have posted photos so you can judge for yourself. Complaints: No full-length mirror in the room. We asked if we could be moved to a room that had one, but were told no rooms have them. The poolside food was not terrible, but it wasn't great either (my boyfriend had a burger, I had a salad). We also didn't like having to hand in towel cards every time we wanted a towel for the pool/beach. Same with the business center - any time you want to use it, you need to stop by the front desk so they could give you an access card. I understand the reasoning behind this, but it was still a little annoying. Overall, though, if we were to go back to Rincon, we would definitely consider staying here again. We didn't experience any problems with service (although we didn't really ask for much). The one time we asked for ideas of what to do, the guys at the front desk were helpful, and actually suggested going into Anasco for las "Fiestas Patronales," and we ended up having a great time. One of our favorite salsa singers, Tito Rojas, performed, and we got to see him live. I hope you find this review helpful! I make it a point to write reviews when I stay places, as I so much appreciate the feedback when I need to find a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here and loved this resort! The rooms are simple and clean and the staff is very friendly. It is in a great location for exploring other areas or just relaxing on the beach. The resort restaurant is just average, so explore and find cheaper, better meals such as at Antojos. We especially loved watching the sunsets on the beach with a bottle of wine!

Reviews.Title: “a little out of touch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean, friendly, convenient location. But the blaring music on friday night in the middle of the main courtyard is too much; well I hope I didn't have to pay extra for this "performance" Still here, and the "do-tink-to" is blaring away on the 5$ casio keyboard and 100000 (ok, an exageration) watt peavy amps at 11pm. Would have given it a good review, but the putting green has a single lefty putter for someone under 5ft tall; the sailboats that you can see, you cannot use. Waitstaff has serious problems with english from time to time. The hot tub is kinda warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 wonderful weeks at the Rincon Beach Resort. This was my second stay at the resort and I have to say I continue to be impressed by the quality of service and ammenities. All of the staff are accomodating,courteous and anxious to please. The onsite manager is a consumate professional. For anyone venturing to this paradise, I recommend Rincon Beach Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Rincon Beach Resort Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Sarck
Reviews.Content: We had read only a couple reviews about this hotel before we headed to Rincon Beach Resort so we realized we were taking a gamble. But both the town and the resort made us feel like we made the right choice after our 5-day stay. The staff at the resort upgraded us upon check in from a room to a suite. All food and drinks (except dinner) was covered in our room rate. The room was amazing -- clean, comfortable and had an excellent view of the private beach. We rarely go anyplace twice, but we would go here again.. and again... and again...

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We're just back from 3 nights at the RBS. Overall, this hotel is above average in terms of the quality of the service, the ambiance and the resort employees. The beach is very nice as it is secluded and the water is clear, with no waves at all. Our room was very nice with an ocean view, 2 queen beds and balcony. There is only one restaurant, open for breakfast and dinner and there's a snack bar by the beach for lunch. We found the breakfast and lunches to be good for the money but the dinner was way too expensive and not that good. Fortunately, there are good local restaurants within a short drive. Overall, we think we will probably go back to the RBS in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pretty well kept, clean...friendly staff. Food/drinks on the high end for the location...overall a pretty enjoyable experience. No lights @ the pool @ nite due to turtle nestings! Water not to clean @ the beach..but whole area is the same. Area restaurants are ok, however Rincon Tropical wait was over 1.5 hrs for mahi-mahi ..I guess they guys went fishing for the fish, huh! I wouldn't recommend this restaurant due to excessive wait time .....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: whyersc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days at this hotel and really enjoyed ourselves. The grounds are very clean and well landscaped. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly desk clerk telling us we were upgraded to a 1 bdrm suite - which essentially was a condo. It was extremely clean and quite comfortable. The lobby is just lovely being completely open with a stunning view of the manicured courtyard, pool and ocean. The lobby is filled with nice furniture arrangements to mingle with guests, sit alone or sit at the bar. There's a business office, too, which offers free internet service - which was very convenient. I do agree with comments on keeping the beach more litter free. On the weekends it attracts more guests and locals and it should have been cleaned throughout the day. It wasn't awful, but it could have been cleaner. There's plenty of lounge chairs to go around too which is nice. The pool is fantastic and the swim-up bar is nice but I was frustrated more than once when a bartender could not be found at the pool or in the lobby - even at peak times. I'm on vacation! I want to those foo-foo drinks! The restaurant's menu is great if you're a beef eater - I'm not and was challenged not to have several repeat dinners. My hubby did rave on several of the steak dishes. Meals are a bit on the pricey side - like $20 for fish and $6 for a dinner salad - which is not included in the meal. They do have a GREAT wine list. There are great beaches to the north and south of this hotel if you're up for a little adventure driving around. Getting to the hotel IS NOT a problem. Although I did find the map on their website to be incorrect. From the SJU airport you take HWY 26, not 52. All else is correct. Roads are all well marked. It takes 2.5 - 3 hours from SJU. We would absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Review by PR native”
Reviews.Author: CarlosERG
Reviews.Content: I try to be as critical as possible of most of the places I visit on the island just because as an islander I see what we provide visitors in terms of accomodations, service, friendly treament, ammenities, etc. I stayed with my wife overnight as a quick getaway before she gives birth to our first child later this month (june 2005). We stayed on May 21st. Unfortunately the beach was very dirty due to recent heavy rains and rivers that drain into the sea not too far from the resort. But the pool and poolside bar were enough for our short stay. The staff doesn't do a good enough job of keeping the pool clean on a daily basis. There are several big trees near the pool that during this time of year are pollinating and their little flowers end up in the pool. The poolside bar is very convenient. The resort layout is fantastic. It has an ample courtyard in the middle surrounded by the guest room towers (just 6 floors high). Not all the towers have ocean views but the ones that do have are premium. The rooms are confortable and very nicely decorated. Ours was a little musty smelling and the bed comforter needed replacement. Some dust from the ceiling stucco had fallen on top of the bed when we arrived, probably due to filtration problems. The bathroom was quite large for a hotel but the shower head and water pressure were horrendous. Otherwise, very clean and well put. The landscaping on the grounds is well kept and gives the resort a nice laid back feel. The trees on the courtyard are healthy and when in bloom look fabulous. As you make your way into the hotel there is a direct line of sight from the lobby through the courtyard and to the pool area and ocean horizon. That is great architectural design. It gives you a sense of place as soon as you get there. The lobby is open and has a small bar for a mid afternoon drink or post meal cocktail. We only had breakfast at the restaurant but although pricey, the food is very good and plenty. Their dinner menu is mostly meats and is supposedly real good. They have an open kitchen so you see your food being cooked. The size of the resort is perfect. It's small but well proportioned so nothing is too far but at the same time you don't feel crammed up. I'd reccommend this resort to anyone coming to visit PR or any local looking for a quick retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went there in early may 2005 for 3 days; upon arrival (on a Tuesday), there were about 5 people in the hotel, so the whole pool and beach was ours; Hotel room: very clean with ocean view, newly built, nice balconies, refrigerator, built-in-safe, clean bathroom; Pool: clean, large; the jacuzzi worked only on the day of our arrival, then they cleaned it and opened it up two days later when we were leaving; Beach: small, nothing special Food: did not try the food in their restaurant since there were so few people in and thought we're better off going out to Rincon and Malaguyez; drinks at the poolside bar were very good, but a little on the expensive side ($5-7 each) Local area: having a car is a must; we went out to eat for every meal except breakfast; the closest decent restaurant is about 1/2 mile towards Rincon, called "The carriage" or something like that; Many other choices in the surrounding cities; Driving: not as bad as other complained (however I'm born in Europe and used to this type of traffic); just don't rent a huhe SUV and you'll be fine. The downside: Isolated from the city, gets boring if you don't have a car Conclusion: if a quiet sunny beach away from the rest of the world is your thing, then this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Greate Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the drive from San Juan was kind of grueling, the Rincon Beach Resort was definitely worth the trip. We arrived in late January, just in time to miss the major blizzard that hit the Northeast. The hotel itself looks even better than pictured, very pretty. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. We had an ocean view on the third floor and were treated to a beautiful sunset each evening as we dressed for dinner. Except for a few fallen leaves, the beach was clean as was the pool. The poolside bar was a real treat, most any drink was available there. The food at the beach snack bar was good and fairly reasonable. The hotel restaurant was outstanding but the dinner menu was fairly expensive. There is a nice breakfast buffet, also menu offerings. Because we always had a late breakfast, we never tried the lunches. Even though it's still the Atlantic Ocean, the water was a deep blue color, not the grey we're used to in New Jersey. Because the resort is located in a cove, the water was calm with relatively few waves, and very clear. The hotel is surrounded by mountains, very scenic. The surrounding neighborhood is very relaxed with a lot of inexpensive bars. Friendly area. Staff at hotel was great. Though I rated the hotel as 4 stars, above average, it really was an excellent experience and I would return to Rincon in a moment!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: ezmax
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 4 nights at the Rincon Beach Resort (April 4th to 8th, 2005). We had a great time!!! We (my wife and my son (3)) stayed in the Deluxe room on the 2nd floor: the room and the bathroom were clean and the balcony was facing west for great sunsets (when it didn't rain). The resort is a bit expansive; we ate at the restaurant the first night, the food was very good, but a bit to expansive for our budget. All other nights, we went to Rincon for dinner: local food is fantastic, and the prices are very acceptable (for food and drinks). We had breakfast at the resort, they have a nice buffet, but the menu is also very good (if you are 2 adults, I recommend one of you to choose from the menu). For lunch the pool side restaurant offered some great sandwiches, burgers... Contrary to the previous review, the beach and the pool were clean (no cigarette buts ...) the beach was pretty calm, it's not yet the Caribbean sea, so it's not blue, but it's very clear. The pool was nice (a bit of sand in the bottom). My son loves to play in the sand, and we did not find anything dangerous while making sand castles. Rincon is a very nice little town, we went to the lighthouse, check out some surfers, there is also a science museum but it was close (it's open in the morning). You need a car to enjoy some site seeing. And if you have forgot beach toys for your kids, don't worry there are plenty of stores (Kmart and others) where you can get all these things.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment at it's best”
Reviews.Author: McC60
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay March 24-29, 2005. The pictures you see of the Rincon Beach Resort are in fact accurate, because they are far away. We were sorely disappointed in this "resort" hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights, but would have left if we had not already paid in full up front. The rooms are fine, but the bathroom is very small - with 4 people it makes it almost unmanageable. The pool was dirty - kids dumping their drinks it it daily and the stuff from the trees falling into it (this can't be helped, but the drink thing can). The giant hot tub would have been inviting had it not been green - all the toddlers and kids played in it! The pool bar ran out of most all of the food by friday (we arrived Thursday) and their excuse was " it's the weekend" - wouldn't that be when a hotel would be MOST supplied? They also ran out of many of the bar mixers. The food at the restaurant was good, but very expensive. The food at the pool bar was all fried. We only ate breakfasts there and ventured into Rincon and Mayaguez for other meals. Beware - the drinks are expensive as well. The beach was a total disappointment. The sand is so full of rocks, seashells, cig butts and branches that it's difficult to walk out on. The water is a lovely shade of brown. No caribbean blue found here! There is no concierge either. No motorized sports around and only beat up paddle boards and boats to rent. Go elsewhere for entertainment. The one thing that I really couldn't stand was that the stairwells were filthy. Food, dead bugs, gum and worst of all hair!!!!! EEEEW! They weren't cleaned once in the 5 days we were there! They did show movies outside one night (friday, I think) and had an outrageously loud band playing in the center plaza until 10. Other than that - the only thing to do is catch sun. That's about it. The resort buildings are really pretty, but this "resort" has a lot of work to do if it wants to compete with others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific find in Rincon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (2 teen-agers and husband) just returned from a 6 night stay at the Rincon Beach Resort. We loved it and are looking forward to returning next year. The rooms were above average, not luxurious, but certainly adequate. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The food was just okay, and pretty expensive, but if you rent a car there are many other dining options in the town of Rincon. We thought the pool area was spectacular and enjoyed some of the water sports that are available for a nominal fee. The ocean is like a lagoon on this side of town. For super body surfing go over to Maria's or Sandy Beach. We very much recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Went for Valentine's Dinner, must have been an off night”
Reviews.Author: Rustyswife
Reviews.Content: Did not stay here but had dinner on Valentine's Day 2005 by the pool. One security light lit the area with no candles on the tables. It was so dark, we could not see the menus nor could the waitress see her paper. She was sweet but very confused by our requests and could not speak English well. It took forever for the meal and the dishes were served sporadically to the four of us. Finally, our meals were very good but we received a side dish so full of salt it was inedible. In all the price was VERY high for Rincon, where we have vacation home, and the pool front dining needs some thought. In all fairness, last year we had dinner in the restaurant and it was just great. We came back expecting the same and were disappointed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle Island, Long Island, New York
Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: sambuca
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort! The staff was wonderful! Our only complaint was that our room seemed to attract alot of noise in the morning, particularly banging, which seemed to be coming from housekeeping. I guess we could have said something, but everything else was perfect, so we just let it go. We would reccomend this hotel to anyone, we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beach Location for everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-day stay at RBR over the Thanksgiving weekend. I had read all previous reviews and couldn't decide between this property and Rincon of the Seas, but the fact the RBR had refrigerators tipped the scales for us, with three children, ages 8, 3, and 1. This is a prime beach location, with the beach only steps away from any of the rooms, and the infinity pool very conveniently located at the edge of the sand, with a boardwalk separating the pool and beach. The water in the sea was calm and warm, and the pool and hot tub were ideally situated. Despite the holiday weekend, we felt that it was not very crowded. We were able to reserve shaded beach chairs both on the boardwalk (next to the pool) and on the beach itself, near the water. By Sunday afternoon, we felt like we were the only ones there--in fact there were only eight cars in the parking lot! For families, the location is ideal--the restaurant was rather pricey and too formal for our active kids, so we got up early the first day and drove into Rincon on Route 115 to a grocery store and bought provisions for all of our breakfasts and snacks (hence the necessity of a refrigerator). After a full day at the pool/beach, we ventured out toward Mayaguez on Route 115 and then Route 2 and found a shopping plaza with several restaurants and fast food chains. If we had stayed longer we might have tried Brasas, the onsite restaurant, which also had a children's menu with at least five different items at $6.95 each. The resort caters to couples and families alike, and we felt that the staff was friendly and quite accomodating. Small inconveniences about the room were quickly remedied, and the ocean view room with balcony came with a stunning view. The room was clean and smelled clean as well. One downside was the fact that on Monday morning there was no water, as the reserve tanks were empty, and we had to wait until noon for reserve water trucks to arrive from San Juan. For a quiet, relaxing, stunning beach location, consider this property. Do note that there is no shopping in the immediate area--we weren't able to purchase any souvenirs at all until we went to the airport. I would consider a car a must for this location. Traffic was never too bad, and at one point we traveled in 15 minutes from the resort to the university in Mayaguez during the late afternoon "rush hour."

HotelInfo.Name: Rincon Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Road 115 km 5.8, Anasco 00610, Puerto Rico
